title: Toy Story (1995)

actors: Walter Matthau, Jack Lemmon, Sophia Loren, Ann-Margret

title: Cutthroat Island (1995)

actors: Sammi Davis, Amanda De Cadenet, Valeria Golino, Madonna

description: Theatrical film of Persuasion with Ciaran Hinds & Amanda Root. Directed by Roger Michell.

title: Dangerous Minds (1995)
actors: Michelle Pfeiffer, George Dzundza, Courtney B. Vance, Robin Bartlett

actors: Joseph Melito, Bruce Willis, Jon Seda, Michael Chance

title: Babe (1995)
actors: Christine Cavanaugh, Miriam Margolyes, Danny Mann, Hugo Weaving
description: Babe, a pig raised by sheepdogs on a rural English farm, learns to herd sheep with a little help from Farmer Hoggett.

title: Dead Man Walking (1995)
actors: Susan Sarandon, Sean Penn, Robert Prosky, Raymond J. Barry

title: It Takes Two (1995)

description: Alyssa and Amanda are two little girls who are identical, but complete strangers, that accidentally meet one day.

title: Clueless (1995)

title: Cry, the Beloved Country (1995)
actors: James Earl Jones, Richard Harris, Vusi Kunene, Charles S. Dutton

title: Richard III (1995)
actors: Christopher Bowen, Edward Jewesbury, Ian McKellen, Bill Paterson
description: The classic Shakespearean play about the murderously scheming 15th-century king is reimagined in an alternative setting of 1930s England as clouds of fascism gather.

title: Dead Presidents (1995)
actors: Larenz Tate, Keith David, Chris Tucker, Freddy Rodríguez
description: A Vietnam vet adjusts to life after the war while trying to support his family, but the chance of a better life may involve crime and bloodshed.

title: Restoration (1995)
actors: Robert Downey Jr. , Sam Neill, David Thewlis, Polly Walker
description: The exiled royal physician to King Charles II devotes himself to helping Londoners suffering from the plague, and in the process falls in love with an equally poor woman.

title: Mortal Kombat (1995)
actors: Christopher Lambert, Robin Shou, Linden Ashby, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa
description: Three unknowing martial artists are summoned to a mysterious island to compete in a tournament whose outcome will decide the fate of the world.

title: To Die For (1995)
actors: Nicole Kidman, Matt Dillon, Joaquin Phoenix, Casey Affleck

title: How to Make an American Quilt (1995)
actors: Kaelynn Craddick, Sara Craddick, Kate Capshaw, Adam Baldwin
description: Bride-to-be Finn Dodd hears tales of romance and sorrow from her elders as they construct a quilt.

title: Seven (a.k.a. Se7en) (1995)
actors: Morgan Freeman, Andrew Kevin Walker, Daniel Zacapa, Brad Pitt
description: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.

title: Pocahontas (1995)
actors: Joe Baker, Christian Bale, Irene Bedard, Billy Connolly
description: An English soldier and the daughter of an Algonquin chief share a romance when English colonists invade seventeenth century Virginia.

title: When Night Is Falling (1995)
actors: Pascale Bussières, Rachael Crawford, Henry Czerny, David Fox
description: An uptight and conservative woman, working on tenure as a literacy professor at a large urban university, finds herself strangely attracted to a free-spirited, liberal woman who works at a local carnival that comes to town.

title: Usual Suspects, The (1995)
actors: Stephen Baldwin, Gabriel Byrne, Benicio Del Toro, Kevin Pollak
description: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat, which began when five criminals met at a random police lineup.

title: Mighty Aphrodite (1995)
actors: Pamela Blair, Rene Ceballos, Elie Chaib, George De La Pena
description: When he discovers his adopted son is a genius, a New York sportswriter seeks out the boy's birth mother: a ditzy porn star and prostitute.

title: Lamerica (1994)
actors: Enrico Lo Verso, Michele Placido, Piro Milkani, Carmelo Di Mazzarelli
description: Immediately after the fall of communism in Albania, two Italians go there to embezzle investment money by creating a fake company. As the chairman/fall guy, they pick a former political prisoner who turns out to be more than meets the eye.

title: Big Green, The (1995)
actors: Steve Guttenberg, Olivia d'Abo, Jay O. Sanders, John Terry
description: A teacher on exchange from England is placed in an underachieving Texas school, where she coaches the students in soccer, improving their self-esteem and leading to unexpected success.

title: Georgia (1995)
actors: Jennifer Jason Leigh, Mare Winningham, Ted Levine, Max Perlich
description: Sadie is desperately looking up to her older sister Georgia who is a famous C&W artist. Her desperate need to be accepted by her sister is constantly complicated by her drug and alcohol problems.

title: Home for the Holidays (1995)
actors: Holly Hunter, Robert Downey Jr. , Anne Bancroft, Charles Durning
description: After losing her job, making out with her soon-to-be former boss, and finding out that her daughter plans to spend Thanksgiving with her boyfriend, Claudia Larson faces spending the holiday with her family.

title: Postman, The (Postino, Il) (1994)
actors: Philippe Noiret, Massimo Troisi, Maria Grazia Cucinotta, Renato Scarpa
description: A simple Italian postman learns to love poetry while delivering mail to a famous poet, and then uses this to woo local beauty Beatrice.

title: Indian in the Cupboard, The (1995)
actors: Hal Scardino, Litefoot, Lindsay Crouse, Richard Jenkins
description: Omri, a young boy growing up in Brooklyn, receives an odd variety of presents for his birthday: a wooden cupboard from his older brother, a set of antique keys from his mother, and a plastic Indian from his best friend, Patrick.

title: Eye for an Eye (1996)
actors: Sally Field, Ed Harris, Olivia Burnette, Alexandra Kyle
description: When the courts fail to keep behind bars the man who raped and murdered her daughter, a woman seeks her own form of justice.

title: Mr. Holland's Opus (1995)
actors: Richard Dreyfuss, Glenne Headly, Jay Thomas, Olympia Dukakis
description: A frustrated composer finds fulfillment as a high school music teacher.

title: Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood (1996)
actors: Shawn Wayans, Marlon Wayans, Tracey Cherelle Jones, Chris Spencer
description: A parody of several U.S. films about being in the 'Hood', for instance Boyz n the Hood (1991), Южный централ (1992), Угроза для общества (1993), Bыcшее образование (1995) and Авторитет (1992).

title: Two if by Sea (1996)
actors: Denis Leary, Sandra Bullock, Stephen Dillane, Yaphet Kotto
description: A couple steals a Matisse painting on contract. They manage to escape the police. The sale takes place 4 days later on an island. Things don't go as planned.

title: Bio-Dome (1996)
actors: William Atherton, Denise Dowse, Dara Tomanovich, Kevin West
description: Moronic best friends get themselves locked inside the Bio-Dome, a science experiment, along with a group of environmental scientists for one year.

title: Lawnmower Man 2: Beyond Cyberspace (1996)
actors: Patrick Bergin, Matt Frewer, Austin O'Brien, Ely Pouget
description: After the destruction of Virtual Space Industries at the end of the first film, Jobe is discovered in the rubble and is brought to the facilities of Jonathan Walker (Kevin Conway), a powerful corporate tycoon, where his face is reconstructed and he is hooked back online through virtual reality to work for Walker. Several years later, in a dystopian Los Angeles, Peter Parkette (Austin O'Brien), is now a teenager and a computer hacker living in the subways with a group of runaway teenagers after the events of the first film. Jobe finds Peter online and asks him to find Benjamin Trace (Patrick Bergin), the founder of virtual reality. After finding Trace and bringing him to his hideout, Peter discovers Jobe is looking to start a new world order, using Walker's technology. Now, Trace, Peter, Trace's former lover Cori (Ely Pouget), and Peter's friends, are on a race against time to stop Jobe and Walker from enslaving humanity through virtual reality.

title: French Twist (Gazon maudit) (1995)
actors: Victoria Abril, Josiane Balasko, Alain Chabat, Ticky Holgado
description: After learning of her husband's infidelities, a housewife invites an itinerant lesbian to move in with them. None of their lives will ever be the same again.

title: Friday (1995)
actors: Ice Cube, Chris Tucker, Nia Long, Tom Lister Jr.
description: It's Friday, and Craig and Smokey must come up with $200 they owe a local bully or there won't be a Saturday.

title: From Dusk Till Dawn (1996)
actors: George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino, Harvey Keitel, Juliette Lewis
description: Two criminals and their hostages unknowingly seek temporary refuge in a truck stop populated by vampires, with chaotic results.

title: Fair Game (1995)
actors: William Baldwin, Cindy Crawford, Steven Berkoff, Christopher McDonald
description: Max Kirkpatrick is a cop who protects Kate McQuean, a civil law attorney, from a renegade KGB team out to terminate her.

title: Kicking and Screaming (1995)
actors: Josh Hamilton, Samuel Gould, Catherine Kellner, Jonathan Baumbach
description: A bunch of guys hang around their college for months after graduation, continuing a life much like the one before graduation.

title: Misérables, Les (1995)
actors: Jean-Paul Belmondo, Michel Boujenah, Alessandra Martines, Salomé Lelouch
description: A variation on Victor Hugo's classic novel by means of the story of a man whose life is affected by and somewhat duplicated by the Hugo story of the beleaguered Jean Valjean.

title: Bed of Roses (1996)
actors: Christian Slater, Mary Stuart Masterson, Pamela Adlon, Josh Brolin
description: Romantic drama about a young career girl who is swept off her feet by a shy florist who fell in love with her after one glimpse through a shadowy window.

title: Big Bully (1996)
actors: Rick Moranis, Tom Arnold, Julianne Phillips, Carol Kane
description: A writer returns to his hometown where he faces the childhood nemesis whose life he ultimately ruined, only the bully wants to relive their painful past by torturing him once again.

title: Screamers (1995)
actors: Peter Weller, Roy Dupuis, Jennifer Rubin, Andy Lauer
description: A military commander stationed off planet during an interplanetary war travels through the devastated landscape to negotiate a peace treaty, but discovers that the primitive robots they built to kill enemy combatants have gained sentience.

title: Nico Icon (1995)
actors: Nico, Tina Aumont, Christian Päffgen, Edith Boulogne
description: A look into the many lives of Christa Päffgen, otherwise known as Nico; from cutie German mädchen to the first of the supermodels, to glamorous diva of the Velvet Underground, to cult item, junkie and hag. Many faces for the same woman, whom, you realize, just couldn't bring herself to care enough to live.

title: Crossing Guard, The (1995)
actors: Jack Nicholson, David Morse, Anjelica Huston, Robin Wright
description: Freddy Gale is a seedy jeweller who has sworn to kill the drunk driver who killed his little girl.

title: Juror, The (1996)
actors: Demi Moore, Alec Baldwin, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, James Gandolfini
description: A juror in a Mafia trial is forced to convince the other jurors to vote not guilty by an obsessive mob enforcer.

title: White Balloon, The (Badkonake sefid) (1995)
actors: Aida Mohammadkhani, Mohsen Kafili, Fereshteh Sadre Orafaiy, Anna Borkowska
description: Several people try to help a little girl to find the money her mom gave her to buy a goldfish with.

title: Things to Do in Denver When You're Dead (1995)
actors: Andy Garcia, Christopher Lloyd, William Forsythe, Bill Nunn
description: Five different criminals face imminent death after botching a job quite badly.

title: Antonia's Line (Antonia) (1995)
actors: Willeke van Ammelrooy, Els Dottermans, Dora van der Groen, Veerle van Overloop
description: A Dutch matron establishes and, for several generations, oversees a close-knit, matriarchal community where feminism and liberalism thrive.

title: Once Upon a Time... When We Were Colored (1995)
actors: Al Freeman Jr. , Phylicia Rashad, Leon, Paula Kelly
description: A narrator tells the story of his childhood years in a tightly knit Afro-American community in the deep south under racial segregation.

title: Angels and Insects (1995)
actors: Mark Rylance, Kristin Scott Thomas, Patsy Kensit, Jeremy Kemp
description: In the 1800s a naturalist marries into a family of British country gentry.

title: White Squall (1996)
actors: Jeff Bridges, Caroline Goodall, John Savage, Scott Wolf
description: Teenage boys discover discipline and camaraderie on an ill-fated sailing voyage.

title: Dunston Checks In (1996)
actors: Jason Alexander, Faye Dunaway, Eric Lloyd, Rupert Everett
description: A young boy befriends a larcenous orangutan in a luxury hotel.

title: Black Sheep (1996)
actors: Chris Farley, David Spade, Tim Matheson, Christine Ebersole
description: A gubernatorial candidate hires a wormy special assistant whose only job is to make sure the candidate's well-meaning but incompetent brother doesn't ruin the election.

title: Nick of Time (1995)
actors: Johnny Depp, Courtney Chase, Charles S. Dutton, Christopher Walken
description: An unimpressive, everyday man is forced into a situation where he is told to kill a politician to save his kidnapped daughter.

title: Mary Reilly (1996)
actors: Julia Roberts, John Malkovich, George Cole, Michael Gambon
description: A housemaid falls in love with Dr. Henry Jekyll and his darkly mysterious counterpart, Mr. Edward Hyde.

title: Vampire in Brooklyn (1995)
actors: Eddie Murphy, Angela Bassett, Allen Payne, Kadeem Hardison
description: A ship docks in Brooklyn with all its crew dead, but someone gets off and the killing continues on land. A Caribbean vampire is searching for a specific woman, half-human half-vampire. Rita is the detective investigating the many killings.

title: Beautiful Girls (1996)
actors: Matt Dillon, Noah Emmerich, Annabeth Gish, Lauren Holly
description: A piano player at a crossroads in his life returns home to his friends and their own problems with life and love.

title: Broken Arrow (1996)
actors: John Travolta, Christian Slater, Samantha Mathis, Delroy Lindo
description: Terrorists steal nuclear warheads from the U.S. military but don't count on a pilot and park ranger spoiling their plans.

title: In the Bleak Midwinter (1995)
actors: Richard Briers, Hetta Charnley, Joan Collins, Nicholas Farrell
description: A group of theatre actors plays "Hamlet" in a provincial village, faced with their own temptations, disappointments, and joys.

title: Hate (Haine, La) (1995)
actors: Vincent Cassel, Hubert Koundé, Saïd Taghmaoui, Abdel Ahmed Ghili
description: 24 hours in the lives of three young men in the French suburbs the day after a violent riot.

title: Heidi Fleiss: Hollywood Madam (1995)
actors: Nick Broomfield, Nina Xining Zuo, Madam Alex, Corinne Bohrer
description: A documentary crew from the BBC arrives in L.A. intent on interviewing Heidi Fleiss, a year after her arrest for running a brothel but before her trial. Several months elapse before the interview, so the crew searches for anyone who'll talk about the young woman. Two people have a lot to say to the camera: a retired madam named Alex for whom Fleiss once worked and Fleiss's one-time boyfriend, Ivan Nagy, who introduced her to Alex. Alex and Nagy don't like each other, so the crew shuttles between them with "she said" and "he said." When they finally interview Fleiss, they spend their time reciting what Alex and Nagy have had to say and asking her reaction.

title: City Hall (1996)
actors: Al Pacino, John Cusack, Bridget Fonda, Danny Aiello
description: The accidental shooting of a boy in New York leads to an investigation by the Deputy Mayor, and unexpectedly far-reaching consequences.

title: Bottle Rocket (1996)
actors: Luke Wilson, Owen Wilson, Ned Dowd, Shea Fowler
description: Three friends plan to pull off a simple robbery and go on the run.

title: Mr. Wrong (1996)
actors: Ellen DeGeneres, Bill Pullman, Joan Cusack, Dean Stockwell
description: A lonely single woman finds the seemingly-perfect man to date, but soon regrets it when his deranged, possessive other personality emerges and she cannot convince anyone else of his Jekyll-and-Hyde true nature.

title: Unforgettable (1996)
actors: Ray Liotta, Linda Fiorentino, Peter Coyote, Christopher McDonald
description: A medical examiner, who was suspected of murdering his wife, is trying an experimental drug to retrieve his wife's and others' memory and maybe find the killer and the mass murderer in a related present case.

title: Happy Gilmore (1996)
actors: Adam Sandler, Christopher McDonald, Julie Bowen, Frances Bay
description: A rejected hockey player puts his skills to the golf course to save his grandmother's house.

title: Bridges of Madison County, The (1995)
actors: Clint Eastwood, Meryl Streep, Annie Corley, Victor Slezak
description: Photographer Robert Kincaid wanders into the life of housewife Francesca Johnson for four days in the 1960s.

title: Nobody Loves Me (Keiner liebt mich) (1994)
actors: Maria Schrader, Pierre Sanoussi-Bliss, Michael von Au, Elisabeth Trissenaar
description: On the brink of her 30th birthday, Fanny feels the door to marital happiness closing on her. She is obsessed with death and even visits evening classes on dying, so it seems fitting that she encounters a skeleton in the malfunctioning elevator of her apartment building. The skeleton is her neighbour Orfeo, a Black, gay, self-declared psychic, who convinces her that she is about to meet "him". But is it really Lothar, the new yuppie apartment manager ...?

title: Muppet Treasure Island (1996)
actors: Tim Curry, Billy Connolly, Jennifer Saunders, Kevin Bishop
description: The Muppets' twist on the classic tale.

title: Catwalk (1996)
actors: Christy Turlington, Azzedine Alaïa, Giorgio Armani, Nadja Auermann
description: A camera follows model Christy Turlington through the spring fashion shows in Milan, Paris, and New York one year in the early 1990s, probably 1992. She and others dash from one designer's unveilings to another. Extended footage looks at Versace and Armani in Milan, Galliano, Gaultier, and Langerfeld in Paris, and Isaac Mizrahi in New York. With Kate Moss, Naomi Campbell, and Turlington, we see the nature of friendships among models. With the engaging Mizrahi in particular, there's some exploration of the relationship between designer and models.

title: Braveheart (1995)
actors: James Robinson, Sean Lawlor, Sandy Nelson, James Cosmo
description: Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.

title: Taxi Driver (1976)
actors: Diahnne Abbott, Frank Adu, Victor Argo, Gino Ardito
description: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action.

title: Rumble in the Bronx (Hont faan kui) (1995)
actors: Jackie Chan, Anita Mui, Françoise Yip, Bill Tung
description: A young man visiting and helping his uncle in New York City finds himself forced to fight a street gang and the mob with his martial art skills.

title: Before and After (1996)
actors: Meryl Streep, Liam Neeson, Edward Furlong, Julia Weldon
description: Two parents deal with the effects when their son is accused of murdering his girlfriend.

title: Anne Frank Remembered (1995)
actors: Isa Baschwitz, Mary Bos, Kenneth Branagh, Janny Brandes-Brilslijper
description: Using previously unreleased archival material in addition to contemporary interviews, this academy award-winning documentary tells the story of the Frank family and presents the first fully-rounded portrait of their brash and free-spirited daughter Anne, perhaps the world's most famous victim of the Holocaust.

title: Young Poisoner's Handbook, The (1995)
actors: Tobias Arnold, Ruth Sheen, Roger Lloyd Pack, Hugh O'Conor
description: This film is based on a true story about a British teenager who allegedly poisoned family, friends, and co-workers. Graham is highly intelligent, but completely amoral. He becomes interested in science, especially chemistry, and begins to read avidly. Something of a social misfit, he is fascinated by morbid subjects such as poisons and murder. His family environment is intolerable to him and, in particular, his stepmother torments him. He decides to poison those who annoy him, first with antimony and later with thallium. He smugly thinks himself cleverer than all those around him, but nevertheless he is caught and sentenced to 'rehabilitation' at a psychiatric institution. Once there, he undertakes to deceive the new eminent psychiatrist sent there to 'cure' him, thereby securing his release.

title: If Lucy Fell (1996)
actors: Sarah Jessica Parker, Eric Schaeffer, Ben Stiller, Elle Macpherson
description: Two NYC roommates have a pact to jump off Brooklyn Bridge if they haven't found life partners before she's 30. That's less than a month away.

title: Steal Big, Steal Little (1995)
actors: Andy Garcia, Alan Arkin, Rachel Ticotin, Joe Pantoliano
description: Ruben and Robby are twin brothers, adopted by Mona, one of the wealthiest - and most eccentric - women in Santa Barbara. Ruben is devoted to Mona, but Robby is more devoted to her money. So when Mona leaves her fortune and estate to Ruben it starts a battle between brothers that soon leads to madness, mayhem, and even attempted murder. On Ruben's side is Lou Perilli an ex-Chicago cop and used car dealer who knows the law - and how to get around it. On Robby's side is ruthless businessman Reed Tyler, who is out to turn a swift profit on Mona's property. Walking a shifty line between them is Eddie Agopian, the family lawyer, who doesn't care which side wins as long as he's on the winner's side. But whether they're stealing big or stealing little, they're all stealing in this hilarious comedy about greed, power... and brotherly love.

title: Boys of St. Vincent, The (1992)
actors: Henry Czerny, Johnny Morina, Brian Dooley, Philip Dinn
description: The true story of boys being sexually abused at their orphanage ran by a religious community in Newfoundland.

title: Boomerang (1992)
actors: Eddie Murphy, Robin Givens, Halle Berry, David Alan Grier
description: A successful executive and womanizer finds his lifestyle choices have turned back on him when his new female boss turns out to be an even bigger deviant than he is.

title: Chungking Express (Chung Hing sam lam) (1994)
actors: Brigitte Lin, Tony Leung Chiu-wai, Faye Wong, Takeshi Kaneshiro
description: Two melancholy Hong Kong policemen fall in love: one with a mysterious female underworld figure, the other with a beautiful and ethereal waitress at a late-night restaurant he frequents.

title: Flirting With Disaster (1996)
actors: Ben Stiller, Patricia Arquette, Téa Leoni, Mary Tyler Moore
description: A young man, his wife, and his incompetent case worker travel across country to find his birth parents.

title: NeverEnding Story III, The (1994)
actors: Jason James Richter, Melody Kay, Jack Black, Carole Finn
description: A young boy must restore order when a group of bullies steal the magical book that acts as a portal between Earth and the imaginary world of Fantasia.

title: Jupiter's Wife (1994)
actors: Maggie Cogan, Katina Pendleton
description: Michel Negroponte, a documentary filmmaker, meets Maggie one day in Central Park. Maggie claims to be married to the god Jupiter and the daughter of actor Robert Ryan. Michel gets to know Maggie over the next couple of years, and attempts to use her often outlandish stories as clues to reconstruct her past.

title: Pie in the Sky (1996)
actors: Josh Charles, Anne Heche, John Goodman, Christine Lahti
description: A whimsical saga of a young man whose two life-consuming passions are unraveling traffic gridlock and an avant-garde dancer. A romantic comedy.

title: Jade (1995)
actors: David Caruso, Linda Fiorentino, Chazz Palminteri, Richard Crenna
description: A bright assistant D.A. investigates a gruesome hatchet murder and hides a clue he found at the crime scene. Under professional threats and an attempt on his life, he goes on heartbroken because evidence point to the woman he still loves.

title: Down Periscope (1996)
actors: Kelsey Grammer, Lauren Holly, Rob Schneider, Harry Dean Stanton
description: Lt. Cmdr. Tom Dodge is assigned as Captain to the USS Stingray, an old diesel driven submarine that has seen better days.

title: Man of the Year (1995)
actors: Vivian Paxton, Claudette Sutherland, Michael Ornstein, Cal Bartlett
description: Mockumentary look at Playgirl Magazine centerfold and 1992 Man of the Year, Dirk Shafer, who kept it a secret from the magazine that he is gay. Most of the film is a fictionalized retelling of Dirk's decision to send a photograph to Playgirl, his selection as a centerfold and then Man of the Year, his many TV interviews, his friend Vivian Paxton posing as his beard, and the pressures from his live-in lover to come out of the closet. Interspersed with this chronological narrative are a black and white look at an evening Dirk spends with Angela Lucassey, a woman from Reno who wins Playgirl's national contest to have a date with Dirk, and an interview with a stripper who tracks Dirk down.

title: Up Close and Personal (1996)
actors: Robert Redford, Michelle Pfeiffer, Stockard Channing, Joe Mantegna
description: An ambitious young woman, determined to build a career in television journalism, gets good advice from her first boss, and they fall in love.

title: Birdcage, The (1996)
actors: Robin Williams, Gene Hackman, Nathan Lane, Dianne Wiest
description: A gay cabaret owner and his drag queen companion agree to put up a false straight front so that their son can introduce them to his fiancée's right-wing moralistic parents.

title: Brothers McMullen, The (1995)
actors: Shari Albert, Maxine Bahns, Catharine Bolz, Connie Britton
description: Three Irish Catholic brothers from Long Island struggle to deal with love, marriage, and infidelity.

title: Bad Boys (1995)
actors: Lisa Boyle, Michael Taliferro, Emmanuel Xuereb, Tchéky Karyo
description: Two hip detectives protect a witness to a murder while investigating a case of stolen heroin from the evidence storage room from their police precinct.

title: Amazing Panda Adventure, The (1995)
actors: Stephen Lang, Ryan Slater, Yi Ding, Wang Fei
description: A young American boy visiting China helps his zoologist father rescue a panda cub from unscrupulous poachers while its reserve is threatened with closure from officious bureaucrats.

title: Basketball Diaries, The (1995)
actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Lorraine Bracco, Marilyn Sokol, James Madio
description: A teenager finds his dreams of becoming a basketball star threatened after he free falls into the harrowing world of drug addiction.

title: Awfully Big Adventure, An (1995)
actors: Alan Rickman, Hugh Grant, Georgina Cates, Alun Armstrong
description: Set right after World War II, a naive teenage girl joins a shabby theatre troupe in Liverpool. During a winter production of Peter Pan, the play quickly turns into a dark metaphor for youth as she becomes drawn into a web of sexual politics and intrigue.

title: Amateur (1994)
actors: Isabelle Huppert, Martin Donovan, Elina Löwensohn, Damian Young
description: An amnesiac wakes up on an NYC alley. He meets Isabelle, an ex nun now erotic writer, at a diner and follows her home. She helps him find his identity. Then there's Sofia, the porn star.

title: Rob Roy (1995)
actors: Liam Neeson, Jessica Lange, John Hurt, Tim Roth
description: In 1713 Scotland, Rob Roy MacGregor is wronged by a nobleman and his nephew, becomes an outlaw in search of revenge while fleeing the Redcoats, and faces charges of being a Jacobite.

title: Addiction, The (1995)
actors: Lili Taylor, Christopher Walken, Annabella Sciorra, Edie Falco
description: A New York philosophy grad student turns into a vampire after getting bitten by one, and then tries to come to terms with her new lifestyle and frequent craving for human blood.

title: Batman Forever (1995)
actors: Val Kilmer, Tommy Lee Jones, Jim Carrey, Nicole Kidman
description: Batman must battle former district attorney Harvey Dent, who is now Two-Face and Edward Nygma, The Riddler with help from an amorous psychologist and a young circus acrobat who becomes his sidekick, Robin.

title: Beauty of the Day (Belle de jour) (1967)
actors: Catherine Deneuve, Jean Sorel, Michel Piccoli, Geneviève Page
description: A frigid young housewife decides to spend her midweek afternoons as a prostitute.

title: Beyond Rangoon (1995)
actors: Patricia Arquette, U Aung Ko, Frances McDormand, Spalding Gray
description: Laura is trying to pick up the pieces of her life after the murder of her husband and son, and goes on vacation with her sister to Burma. After losing her passport at a political rally, she is left on her own for a few days, during which time she falls in with students fighting for democracy. She and their leader, U Aung Ko, travel through Burma, whilst witnessing many bloody acts of repression by the dictatorship, in an attempt to escape to Thailand. Based on a true story.

title: Blue in the Face (1995)
director: Paul Auster, Wayne Wang, Harvey Wang
actors: Lou Reed, Michael J. Fox, Roseanne Barr, Mel Gorham
description: Brooklyn Cigar Store is a neighborhood hangout in Brooklyn with Auggie Wren/H.Keitel as center. Some people are interviewed about Brooklyn, spiced up with statistics on Brooklyn.

title: Canadian Bacon (1995)
actors: John Candy, Alan Alda, Rhea Perlman, Kevin Pollak
description: The U.S. President, low in the opinion polls, gets talked into raising his popularity by trying to start a cold war against Canada.

title: Casper (1995)
actors: Chauncey Leopardi, Spencer Vrooman, Malachi Pearson, Cathy Moriarty
description: An afterlife therapist and his daughter meet a friendly young ghost when they move into a crumbling mansion in order to rid the premises of wicked spirits.

title: Clockers (1995)
actors: Harvey Keitel, John Turturro, Delroy Lindo, Mekhi Phifer
description: Young drug pushers in the projects of Brooklyn live hard dangerous lives, trapped between their drug bosses and the detectives out to stop them.

title: Congo (1995)
actors: Laura Linney, Dylan Walsh, Ernie Hudson, Tim Curry
description: When an expedition to the African Congo ends in disaster, a new team is assembled to find out what went wrong.

title: Crimson Tide (1995)
actors: Denzel Washington, Gene Hackman, Matt Craven, George Dzundza
description: On a U.S. nuclear missile sub, a young First Officer stages a mutiny to prevent his trigger happy Captain from launching his missiles before confirming his orders to do so.

title: Crumb (1994)
actors: Robert Crumb, Aline Kominsky-Crumb, Charles Crumb, Maxon Crumb
description: An intimate portrait of controversial cartoonist Robert Crumb and his traumatized family.

title: Desperado (1995)
actors: Antonio Banderas, Salma Hayek, Joaquim de Almeida, Cheech Marin
description: Former musician and gunslinger El Mariachi arrives at a small Mexican border town after being away for a long time. His past quickly catches up with him and he soon gets entangled with the local drug kingpin Bucho and his gang.

title: Devil in a Blue Dress (1995)
actors: Denzel Washington, Tom Sizemore, Jennifer Beals, Don Cheadle
description: An African-American man is hired to find a woman, and gets mixed up in a murderous political scandal.

title: Die Hard: With a Vengeance (1995)
actors: Bruce Willis, Jeremy Irons, Samuel L. Jackson, Graham Greene
description: John McClane and a Harlem store owner are targeted by German terrorist Simon in New York City, where he plans to rob the Federal Reserve Building.

title: Doom Generation, The (1995)
actors: James Duval, Rose McGowan, Johnathon Schaech, Cress Williams
description: Jordan White and Amy Blue, two troubled teens, pick up an adolescent drifter, Xavier Red. Together, the threesome embark on a sex-and-violence-filled journey through an America of psychos and quickie marts.

title: First Knight (1995)
actors: Sean Connery, Richard Gere, Julia Ormond, Ben Cross
description: Lancelot falls in love with Guinevere, who is due to be married to King Arthur. Meanwhile, a violent warlord tries to seize power from Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table.

title: Free Willy 2: The Adventure Home (1995)
actors: Jason James Richter, Francis Capra, Mary Kate Schellhardt, August Schellenberg
description: Teenager Jesse becomes reunited with Willy two years after the whale's jump to freedom as the teenager tries to rescue the killer whale and other orcas from an oil spill.

title: Hackers (1995)
actors: Jonny Lee Miller, Angelina Jolie, Jesse Bradford, Matthew Lillard
description: Hackers are blamed for making a virus that will capsize five oil tankers.

title: Jeffrey (1995)
actors: Steven Weber, Peter Jacobson, Tom Cayler, David Thornton
description: A poignant romantic comedy about the quest for love and intimacy in the age of AIDS. A story of a thirtyish gay actor/waiter who decides to become celibate...the risk of AIDS has taken all the joy from sex.

title: Johnny Mnemonic (1995)
actors: Keanu Reeves, Dina Meyer, Ice-T, Takeshi Kitano
description: A data courier, literally carrying a data package inside his head, must deliver it before he dies from the burden or is killed by the Yakuza.

title: Judge Dredd (1995)
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Armand Assante, Rob Schneider, Jürgen Prochnow
description: In a dystopian future, Joseph Dredd, the most famous Judge (a police officer with instant field judiciary powers), is convicted for a crime he did not commit and must face his murderous counterpart.

title: Jury Duty (1995)
actors: Pauly Shore, Tia Carrere, Stanley Tucci, Brian Doyle-Murray
description: Jobless loser Tommy Collins is sequestered to be a juror in a serial killer trial. He does everything he can to prolong the trial and deliberations to take full advantage of the free lodging and food.

title: Kids (1995)
actors: Leo Fitzpatrick, Sarah Henderson, Justin Pierce, Joseph Chan
description: A day in the life of a group of teens as they travel around New York City skating, drinking, smoking and deflowering virgins.

title: Living in Oblivion (1995)
actors: Steve Buscemi, Catherine Keener, Dermot Mulroney, Danielle von Zerneck
description: This ultimate tribute to all independent filmmakers takes place during one day on the set of a non-budget movie.

title: Lord of Illusions (1995)
actors: J. Trevor Edmond, Daniel von Bargen, Kevin J. O'Connor, Joseph Latimore
description: A private detective gets more than he bargains for when he encounters Philip Swan, a performer whose amazing illusions captivate the world, but they are not really what everyone thinks.

title: Love & Human Remains (1993)
actors: Thomas Gibson, Ruth Marshall, Cameron Bancroft, Mia Kirshner
description: Set in a dreary urban landscape of Edmonton, LOVE AND HUMAN REMAINS is a dark comedy about a group of twentysomethings looking for love and meaning in the '90s. The film focuses on roommates David, a gay waiter who has has given up on his acting career, and Candy, a book reviewer who is also David's ex-lover. David and Candy's lives are entangled with those of David's friends (a busboy, a psychic dominatrix, and a misogynistic civil-servant) and Candy's dates (a male bartender and a lesbian schoolteacher). Meanwhile, a serial killer menaces the concrete and asphalt neighbourhood in which David and Candy live.

title: Mad Love (1995)
actors: Chris O'Donnell, Drew Barrymore, Matthew Lillard, Richard Chaim
description: The wild and sexy story of two passionate young people who take to the road for the incredible adventure of their lives.

title: Mallrats (1995)
actors: Shannen Doherty, Jeremy London, Jason Lee, Claire Forlani
description: Both dumped by their girlfriends, two best friends seek refuge in the local mall.

title: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie (1995)
actors: Karan Ashley, Johnny Yong Bosch, Steve Cardenas, Jason David Frank
description: A giant egg is unearthed at a construction site and soon opened, releasing the terrible Ivan Ooze, who wreaks vengeance on Zordon for imprisoning him millennia ago. With Zordon dying and their powers lost, the Rangers head to a distant planet to find the mystic warrior Dulcea.

title: Mute Witness (1994)
actors: Marina Zudina, Fay Ripley, Evan Richards, Oleg Yankovskiy
description: A mute make-up artist working on a slasher movie being shot in Moscow, is locked in the studio after hours. While there, she witnesses a brutal murder, and must escape capture.

title: Nadja (1994)

Members of a dysfunctional family of vampires are trying to come to terms with each other, in the wake of their father's death. Meanwhile, they are being hunted by Dr. Van Helsing and his hapless nephew. As in all good vampire movies, forces of love are pitted against forces of destruction.

title: Net, The (1995)
actors: Sandra Bullock, Jeremy Northam, Dennis Miller, Diane Baker
description: A computer programmer stumbles upon a conspiracy, putting her life and the lives of those around her in great danger.

title: Nine Months (1995)
actors: Hugh Grant, Julianne Moore, Tom Arnold, Joan Cusack
description: When he finds out his longtime girlfriend is pregnant, a commitment-phobe realizes he might have to change his lifestyle for better or much, much worse.

title: Safe (1995)
actors: Julianne Moore, Xander Berkeley, Dean Norris, Julie Burgess
description: An affluent and unexceptional homemaker in the suburbs develops multiple chemical sensitivity.

title: Scarlet Letter, The (1995)
actors: Demi Moore, Gary Oldman, Robert Duvall, Lisa Andoh
description: An affair between a young woman and a pastor has disastrous consequences.

title: Showgirls (1995)
actors: Elizabeth Berkley, Kyle MacLachlan, Gina Gershon, Glenn Plummer
description: Nomi, a young carefree drifter, arrives in Las Vegas, Nevada to become a dancer and soon sets about clawing her way to the top of the Vegas showgirls.

title: Smoke (1995)
actors: Giancarlo Esposito, José Zúñiga, Stephen Gevedon, Harvey Keitel
description: A Brooklyn smoke shop is the center of neighborhood activity, and the stories of its customers.

title: Something to Talk About (1995)
actors: Julia Roberts, Dennis Quaid, Robert Duvall, Gena Rowlands
description: A woman's world is rocked when she discovers her husband is cheating on her.

title: Species (1995)
actors: Ben Kingsley, Michael Madsen, Alfred Molina, Forest Whitaker

title: Strange Days (1995)

genres: Action, Crime, Drama, Mystery, Sci-Fi, Thriller

title: Umbrellas of Cherbourg, The (Parapluies de Cherbourg, Les) (1964)
actors: Catherine Deneuve, Nino Castelnuovo, Anne Vernon, Marc Michel
description: A young woman separated from her lover by war faces a life-altering decision.

title: Three Wishes (1995)

description: In an unexplained act of charity, Jeanne Holman, picks up an injured, apparent tramp and takes him home to care for him little realizing who he was, or the effect he would have on her life and those of her family.

actors: Adam Sandler, Darren McGavin, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Bradley Whitford

title: Death and the Maiden (1994)
actors: Sigourney Weaver, Ben Kingsley, Stuart Wilson, Krystia Mova
description: A political activist is convinced that her guest is a man who once tortured her for the government.

title: Dolores Claiborne (1995)
actors: Kathy Bates, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Judy Parfitt, Christopher Plummer

title: Dumb & Dumber (Dumb and Dumber) (1994)

description: Elliot heads for the sexual fantasy island, Eden. He takes some photos of diamond smugglers. They and undercover cops want the photos and follow him to Eden.

title: Ed Wood (1994)
actors: Johnny Depp, Martin Landau, Sarah Jessica Parker, Patricia Arquette

title: French Kiss (1995)

title: Forget Paris (1995)
actors: Billy Crystal, Debra Winger, Joe Mantegna, Cynthia Stevenson

Several days later, while traveling along the coast of British Columbia with his father, John, he and Yellow become stranded when turbulent waters capsize their boat. John and his wife, Katherine, relentlessly badger rescue teams. Angus, schooled by John in wilderness survival skills, and assisted by intelligent Yellow, tries to attract rescuers.

title: Goofy Movie, A (1995)
actors: Bill Farmer, Jason Marsden, Jim Cummings, Kellie Martin

title: Hideaway (1995)
actors: Jeff Goldblum, Christine Lahti, Alicia Silverstone, Jeremy Sisto
description: Hatch gets a special resuscitative medicine after "dying" in a car accident. His wife and daughter only get minor injuries. He gets strange nightmares such as killing a teen girl. Is it just dreams?

title: Fluke (1995)
actors: Samuel L. Jackson, Matthew Modine, Nancy Travis, Eric Stoltz
description: After a man dies in a car crash, he is reincarnated as a dog and attempts to reconnect with his family.

title: Farinelli: il castrato (1994)
actors: Stefano Dionisi, Enrico Lo Verso, Elsa Zylberstein, Caroline Cellier
description: The story of castrato opera singer Carlo Broschi, who enthralled 18th-century European audiences under his stage name Farinelli.

title: Gordy (1995)
actors: Doug Stone, Kristy Young, James Donadio, Deborah Hobart
description: A talking pig named Gordy becomes involved in a quest to save his family from the slaughterhouse.

title: Hoop Dreams (1994)
actors: William Gates, Arthur Agee, Emma Gates, Curtis Gates
description: A film following the lives of two inner-city Chicago boys who struggle to become college basketball players on the road to going professional.

title: Heavenly Creatures (1994)
actors: Melanie Lynskey, Kate Winslet, Sarah Peirse, Diana Kent
description: Two teenage girls share a unique bond; their parents, concerned that the friendship is too intense, separate them, and the girls take revenge.

title: Houseguest (1994)
actors: Sinbad, Phil Hartman, Kim Greist, Kim Murphy

title: Immortal Beloved (1994)
actors: Gary Oldman, Jeroen Krabbé, Isabella Rossellini, Johanna ter Steege
description: The life and death of the legendary Ludwig van Beethoven. Besides all the work he is known for, the composer once wrote a famous love letter to a nameless beloved, and the movie tries to find out who this beloved was--not easy, as Beethoven has had many women in his life.

actors: David Goldman, Joseph Wayne Miller, Cody Burger, Allen Covert

title: I.Q. (1994)
actors: Tim Robbins, Meg Ryan, Walter Matthau, Lou Jacobi
description: A mechanic romances the mathematician niece of physicist Albert Einstein, with help from him and his friends.

title: Interview with the Vampire: The Vampire Chronicles (1994)
actors: Brad Pitt, Christian Slater, Virginia McCollam, John McConnell

description: Nelson Crowe is a CIA operative under the thumb of the Company for a disputed delivery of $50,000 in gold. They blackmail him into working for the Grimes Organization, which is set up as a private company for hire, to blackmail prominent individuals. Crowe, working with Margaret Wells (another former Covert Operations operative), blackmails and bribes a State Supreme Court judge, but the deal sours. One of Crowe's co-workers, Tod Stapp, discovers Crowe's current CIA involvement in a plot to overthrow Grimes, and blackmails him to be cut in on the deal. More blackmail occurs as Wells manipulates Crowe to kill Grimes, then the CIA uses that discovery to blackmail Wells into killing Crowe. Who can you trust???

actors: James Andrews, Mary Beth Aylesworth, Mike Barbour, Steve Bilich
description: Each of the three short films in this collection presents a young gay man at the threshold of adulthood. In "Pool Days," Justin is a 17-year old Bethesda lad, hired as the evening life guard at a fitness center. In the course of the summer, he realizes and embraces that he's gay. In "A Friend of Dorothy," Winston arrives from upstate for his freshman year at NYU. He has to figure out, with some help from Anne, a hometown friend, how to build a social life as a young gay man in the city. In "The Disco Years," Tom looks back on 1978, the year in high school that he came out of the closet after one joyful and several painful encounters.

description: A group of friends in New York, working away at their PCs and laptops, keep in touch exclusively by phone and fax; all are too busy to meet face-to-face. By phone, Gale plays matchmaker for Jerry and Barbara who hit it off beautifully--via phone and fax. Martin gets a telephone call from somebody he has never met: it's Denise, and she has extraordinary news. Tapping away at his computer, he develops a sort of telephonic friendship with Denise. And so it goes as the friends tap, tap, tap away, sharing news, hopes, and dreams--via phone and fax. Finally Gale has an unfortunate encounter with a phone, Denise has more news for Martin, and Frank plans a gala New Year's Eve party--but will he answer the door?

Dennis, the main character, whose lead we follow on this path between what is real and what we can only hope is surreal. His friends attempt to determine if he's truly a psychopath. The story, is told in the form of a succession of ritual-like murders, comes to life through the letters he writes to his sometime lover and best friend Julian and the object of his desire, Julian's younger brother, Kevin. The film is set in an erotic world of sado-masochism and portrays the sexual appetites of a young man for whom killing and engorging the victim become the ultimate thrill.

description: When a sudden shortage of water threatens all life in the great valley, The gang of young dinosaur must cooperate with a group of bullies to make a risky journey outside the valley and find the cause.

actors: Ariane Schluter, Ad van Kempen
description: Sarah, 30, single, well educated, likes art, places a voice ad for phone sex, inviting replies from men under 35, sturdy and sensual. Wilbert, a chubby middle aged architect, leaves a message that he is Thomas, 32 and well formed. A week later, she phones. She likes his voice, he likes her laugh, so once a week she phones him (he's not to know her last name, where she lives, or her number). Portraits emerge of humor and sadness. He presses for details of her life and tells her about his work; she wants these Thursday calls to be fantasy and release, separate from the rest of who she is. The film dramatizes these tensions of lies and truth, connection and distance.

actors: Kathryn Beaumont, Ed Wynn, Richard Haydn, Sterling Holloway
description: Alice stumbles into the world of Wonderland. Will she get home? Not if the Queen of Hearts has her way.

title: Fox and the Hound, The (1981)
director: Ted Berman, Richard Rich, Art Stevens, David Hand, Wolfgang Reitherman
actors: Mickey Rooney, Kurt Russell, Pearl Bailey, Jack Albertson
description: A fox named Tod and a hound named Copper vow to be best friends forever. But as Copper grows into a hunting dog, their unlikely friendship faces the ultimate test.

title: Freeway (1996)
actors: Kiefer Sutherland, Reese Witherspoon, Bokeem Woodbine, Paul Perri
description: A twisted take on "Little Red Riding Hood", with a teenage juvenile delinquent on the run from a social worker travelling to her grandmother's house and being hounded by a charming, but sadistic, serial killer and pedophile.

title: Sound of Music, The (1965)
actors: Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, Eleanor Parker, Richard Haydn
description: A young novice is sent by her convent in 1930s Austria to become a governess to the seven children of a widowed naval officer.

title: Die Hard (1988)
actors: Bruce Willis, Bonnie Bedelia, Reginald VelJohnson, Paul Gleason
description: A New York City police officer tries to save his estranged wife and several others taken hostage by terrorists during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.

title: Lawnmower Man, The (1992)
actors: Jeff Fahey, Pierce Brosnan, Jenny Wright, Mark Bringelson
description: A simple man is turned into a genius through the application of computer science.

title: Secret Agent, The (1996)
actors: Bob Hoskins, Patricia Arquette, Gérard Depardieu, Jim Broadbent
description: London of the late 19th century is a haven for political exiles of all sorts - refugees, partisans, anarchists. Verloc has made his living spying for the Russian government, an agent provocateur of sorts, while simultaneously providing information to the London police, specifically Chief Inspector Heat. When the new Russian ambassador demands he prove his worth or lose his salary, Verloc sets off a tragic chain of events that involves his pretty young wife Winnie, her intellectually disabled brother Stevie, and a figure called the Professor, whose fascination with explosives and destruction makes him the person to call on when Verloc needs a bomb.

title: Secrets & Lies (1996)
actors: Timothy Spall, Phyllis Logan, Brenda Blethyn, Claire Rushbrook
description: Following the death of her adoptive parents, a successful young black optometrist establishes contact with her biological mother -- a lonely white factory worker living in poverty in East London.

title: That Thing You Do! (1996)
actors: Tom Everett Scott, Liv Tyler, Johnathon Schaech, Steve Zahn
description: A local Pennsylvania band scores a one-hit wonder in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as they can, with lots of help from their manager.

title: To Gillian on Her 37th Birthday (1996)
actors: Peter Gallagher, Michelle Pfeiffer, Claire Danes, Laurie Fortier
description: David's wife died 2 years ago. He, his teen daughter Rachel, her cute friend and 2 in-laws trying to fix him up with a friend, are all spending the weekend at his beach house. David still "talks to his wife" and neglects Rachel.

title: Beautiful Thing (1996)
actors: Linda Henry, Glen Berry, Scott Neal, Tameka Empson
description: Jamie is a shy teenager, often bullied at school. His neighbour Ste has a rough time at home, being beaten by his father and brother. This issues bring them together and they find that what they feel for each other is more than friendship.

title: Long Kiss Goodnight, The (1996)
actors: Geena Davis, Samuel L. Jackson, Yvonne Zima, Craig Bierko
description: Samantha Caine lives in a small town with her daughter. Eight years ago she emerged, two months pregnant, from a nearby river with no memory of her past or who she is. However, she's getting closer to finding out about her past.

title: Ghost and the Darkness, The (1996)
actors: Michael Douglas, Val Kilmer, Tom Wilkinson, John Kani
description: A bridge engineer and an experienced old hunter begin a hunt for two lions after they start attacking local construction workers.

title: Looking for Richard (1996)
actors: Penelope Allen, Gordon MacDonald, Madison Arnold, Vincent Angell
description: Al Pacino's deeply-felt rumination on Shakespeare's significance and relevance to the modern world through interviews and an in-depth analysis of "Richard III."

title: Trees Lounge (1996)
actors: Carol Kane, Mark Boone Junior, Steve Buscemi, Bronson Dudley
description: Tommy is an unemployed mechanic who spends most of his time in a bar (Trees Lounge) in a small blue collar town. He seems to always be thinking, "If only X then I could stop drinking".

title: Normal Life (1996)
actors: Ashley Judd, Luke Perry, Bruce A. Young, Jim True-Frost
description: Chris is young idealistic cop who falls in love and gets married to Pam, a beautiful but emotionally unstable woman who suffers from alcoholism and drug addiction. While Chris is trying hard to have a normal life and some money, Pam is big spender and their marriage is constantly troublesome with the financial situation getting worse and worse. The biggest blow comes after Chris loses his job. In the desperate situation Chris decides to use his police skills to rob banks.

title: Get on the Bus (1996)
actors: Richard Belzer, De'aundre Bonds, Andre Braugher, Thomas Jefferson Byrd
description: A disparate group of African-American men travel by bus to Washington, DC for the Million Man March.

title: Shadow Conspiracy (1997)
actors: Charlie Sheen, Donald Sutherland, Linda Hamilton, Stephen Lang
description: Bishop, trusted advisor to the president, has shots fired at him when Pachenko comes to him about a traitor in highest level of government. He gets away from the cold blooded assassin twice. Will he find the traitor before getting killed?

title: Jude (1996)
actors: Christopher Eccleston, Kate Winslet, Liam Cunningham, Rachel Griffiths
description: In late 1800s England, Jude plans to go to the city and attend university but marries early and becomes a stonemason. When his wife leaves, he moves to the city, where he befriends his liberal cousin Sue.

title: Everyone Says I Love You (1996)
actors: Edward Norton, Drew Barrymore, Diva Gray, Ami Almendral
description: A New York girl sets her father up with a beautiful woman in a troubled marriage while her stepsister gets engaged.

title: William Shakespeare's Romeo + Juliet (1996)
actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Claire Danes, John Leguizamo, Harold Perrineau
description: Shakespeare's famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue.

title: Swingers (1996)
actors: Jon Favreau, Vince Vaughn, Ron Livingston, Patrick Van Horn
description: A wannabe actor has a hard time moving on from a break-up, but he is lucky to have supportive friends.

title: Sleepers (1996)
actors: Kevin Bacon, Billy Crudup, Robert De Niro, Ron Eldard
description: After a prank goes disastrously wrong, a group of boys are sent to a detention center where they are brutalized. Thirteen years later, an unexpected random encounter with a former guard gives them a chance for revenge.

title: Aladdin and the King of Thieves (1996)
actors: Val Bettin, Jim Cummings, Gilbert Gottfried, Linda Larkin
description: The King of Thieves disrupts Aladdin and Jasmine's long-anticipated wedding, looking for an oracle that will lead him to an even bigger treasure. His true identity causes trouble for Aladdin.
genres: Animation, Children, Comedy, Fantasy, Musical, Romance

title: Shall We Dance (1937)
actors: Fred Astaire, Ginger Rogers, Edward Everett Horton, Eric Blore
description: A ballet dancer and a showgirl fake a marriage for publicity purposes, then fall in love.

title: Crossfire (1947)
actors: Robert Young, Robert Mitchum, Robert Ryan, Gloria Grahame
description: A man is murdered, apparently by one of a group of demobilized soldiers he met in a bar. But which one? And why?

title: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory (1971)
actors: Gene Wilder, Jack Albertson, Peter Ostrum, Roy Kinnear
description: A poor but hopeful boy seeks one of the five coveted golden tickets that will send him on a tour of Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory.

title: Innocents, The (1961)
actors: Deborah Kerr, Peter Wyngarde, Megs Jenkins, Michael Redgrave
description: A young governess for two children becomes convinced that the house and grounds are haunted.

title: Sleeper (1973)
actors: Woody Allen, Diane Keaton, John Beck, Mary Gregory
description: A nerdish store owner is revived out of cryostasis into a future world to fight an oppressive government.

title: Bananas (1971)
actors: Woody Allen, Louise Lasser, Carlos Montalbán, Nati Abascal
description: When a bumbling New Yorker is dumped by his activist girlfriend, he travels to a tiny Latin American nation and becomes involved in its latest rebellion.

title: Fish Called Wanda, A (1988)
actors: John Cleese, Jamie Lee Curtis, Kevin Kline, Michael Palin
description: In London, four very different people team up on a jewel heist, then try to double-cross one another for the loot, complicated by their efforts to fool a very proper barrister.

title: Monty Python's Life of Brian (1979)
actors: Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Terry Gilliam, Eric Idle
description: Born on the original Christmas in the stable next door to Jesus Christ, Brian of Nazareth spends his life being mistaken for a messiah.

title: Victor/Victoria (1982)
actors: Julie Andrews, James Garner, Robert Preston, Lesley Ann Warren
description: A struggling female soprano finds work playing a male female impersonator, but it complicates her personal life.

title: Candidate, The (1972)
actors: Robert Redford, Peter Boyle, Melvyn Douglas, Don Porter
description: Bill McKay is a candidate for the U.S. Senate from California. He has no hope of winning, so he is willing to tweak the establishment.

title: Great Race, The (1965)
actors: Jack Lemmon, Tony Curtis, Natalie Wood, Peter Falk
description: In the early 20th century, two rivals, the heroic Leslie and the despicable Professor Fate, engage in an epic automobile race from New York to Paris.

title: Bonnie and Clyde (1967)
actors: Warren Beatty, Faye Dunaway, Michael J. Pollard, Gene Hackman
description: Bored waitress Bonnie Parker falls in love with an ex-con named Clyde Barrow and together they start a violent crime spree through the country, stealing cars and robbing banks.

title: Old Man and the Sea, The (1958)
actors: Spencer Tracy, Felipe Pazos, Harry Bellaver, Richard Alameda
description: An old Cuban fisherman's dry spell is broken when he hooks a gigantic fish that drags him out to sea.

title: Dial M for Murder (1954)
actors: Ray Milland, Grace Kelly, Robert Cummings, John Williams
description: A former tennis star arranges the murder of his adulterous wife.

title: Dirty Dancing (1987)
actors: Jennifer Grey, Patrick Swayze, Jerry Orbach, Cynthia Rhodes
description: Spending the summer at a Catskills resort with her family, Frances "Baby" Houseman falls in love with the camp's dance instructor, Johnny Castle.

title: Reservoir Dogs (1992)
actors: Harvey Keitel, Tim Roth, Michael Madsen, Chris Penn
description: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

title: Platoon (1986)
actors: Keith David, Forest Whitaker, Francesco Quinn, Kevin Dillon
description: Chris Taylor, a neophyte recruit in Vietnam, finds himself caught in a battle of wills between two sergeants, one good and the other evil. A shrewd examination of the brutality of war and the duality of man in conflict.

title: Weekend at Bernie's (1989)
actors: Andrew McCarthy, Jonathan Silverman, Catherine Mary Stewart, Terry Kiser
description: Two idiots try to pretend that their murdered employer is really alive, leading the hitman to attempt to track him down to finish him off.

title: Basic Instinct (1992)
actors: Michael Douglas, Sharon Stone, George Dzundza, Jeanne Tripplehorn
description: A violent police detective investigates a brutal murder that might involve a manipulative and seductive novelist.

title: Doors, The (1991)
actors: Val Kilmer, Meg Ryan, Kyle MacLachlan, Frank Whaley
description: The story of the famous and influential 1960s rock band The Doors and its lead singer and composer, Jim Morrison, from his days as a UCLA film student in Los Angeles, to his untimely death in Paris, France at age 27 in 1971.

title: Crying Game, The (1992)
actors: Forest Whitaker, Miranda Richardson, Stephen Rea, Adrian Dunbar
description: A British soldier kidnapped by the IRA soon befriends one of his captors, who then becomes drawn into the soldier's world.

title: Glengarry Glen Ross (1992)
actors: Al Pacino, Jack Lemmon, Alec Baldwin, Alan Arkin
description: An examination of the machinations behind the scenes at a real estate office.

title: Sophie's Choice (1982)
actors: Meryl Streep, Kevin Kline, Peter MacNicol, Rita Karin
description: Sophie is the survivor of Nazi concentration camps, who has found a reason to live with Nathan, a sparkling if unsteady American Jew obsessed with the Holocaust.

title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982)
actors: Dee Wallace, Henry Thomas, Peter Coyote, Robert MacNaughton
description: A troubled child summons the courage to help a friendly alien escape from Earth and return to his home planet.

title: Christmas Carol, A (1938)
actors: Reginald Owen, Gene Lockhart, Kathleen Lockhart, Terry Kilburn
description: An elderly miser learns the error of his ways on Christmas Eve.

title: Days of Thunder (1990)
actors: Tom Cruise, Robert Duvall, Nicole Kidman, Randy Quaid
description: A young hot-shot stock car driver gets his chance to compete at the top level.

title: Top Gun (1986)
actors: Tom Cruise, Kelly McGillis, Val Kilmer, Anthony Edwards
description: As students at the United States Navy's elite fighter weapons school compete to be best in the class, one daring young pilot learns a few things from a civilian instructor that are not taught in the classroom.

title: Rebel Without a Cause (1955)
actors: James Dean, Natalie Wood, Sal Mineo, Jim Backus
description: A rebellious young man with a troubled past comes to a new town, finding friends and enemies.

title: Streetcar Named Desire, A (1951)
actors: Vivien Leigh, Marlon Brando, Kim Hunter, Karl Malden
description: Disturbed Blanche DuBois moves in with her sister in New Orleans and is tormented by her brutish brother-in-law while her reality crumbles around her.

title: Children of the Corn IV: The Gathering (1996)
actors: Naomi Watts, Jamie Renée Smith, Karen Black, Mark Salling
description: All the kids in a town over night become feverish and have convulsions. The next day they start to become evil, change their names for those of kids killed long ago, and then start killing any adult in their path, in vicious and mysterious forms. A young woman who has just returned to town tries to find out what is happening, while trying to protect her transformed young sister. However, the kids are starting to revive their leader...

title: Loser (1991)
actors: Brendan Kelly, John Salemmo, Nadine Miral, Bernice DeLeo
description: A dark comedy about the wild night Hank has when he discovers that he has won a $200 million lottery jackpot.

title: Microcosmos (Microcosmos: Le peuple de l'herbe) (1996)
actors: Jacques Perrin, Kristin Scott Thomas
description: A documentary on insect life in meadows and ponds.

title: Palookaville (1996)
actors: William Forsythe, Vincent Gallo, Adam Trese, Gareth Williams
description: Jerry and his two pals, Russ and Syd, are just looking for some easy money to help them break out of their nowhere lives in their nowhere town. Despite a bungled jewelry store heist which exposes their incompetence as criminals, a fateful event (and an old black-and-white film) convinces them that they can pull off an armored-truck robbery. While they are busy plotting their caper, their dysfunctional families spin out of control all around them.

title: Funeral, The (1996)
actors: Christopher Walken, Chris Penn, Annabella Sciorra, Isabella Rossellini
description: After the funeral of one of their own, a criminal family decides to embark on an emotionally unnerving journey in an attempt to exact bloody revenge.

title: Single Girl, A (Fille seule, La) (1995)
actors: Virginie Ledoyen, Benoît Magimel, Dominique Valadié, Michel Bompoil
description: One morning Valerie has to tell her unemployed boyfriend Remi that she is pregnant. She has decided to keep the child, but they argue whether they should break up or not. That same day she starts working in room service at a smart hotel.

title: Eighth Day, The (Huitième jour, Le) (1996)
actors: Daniel Auteuil, Pascal Duquenne, Miou-Miou, Henri Garcin
description: An unusual and wonderful friendship develops between a busy but unhappy salesman and a resident of a mental asylum.

title: Drunks (1995)
actors: Richard Lewis, Liza Harris, Liam Ahern, George Martin
description: The lives of Jim and other alcoholics in and outside an AA meeting.

title: People vs. Larry Flynt, The (1996)
actors: Woody Harrelson, Courtney Love, Edward Norton, Brett Harrelson
description: The story of controversial pornography publisher Larry Flynt, and how he became a defender of free speech.

title: Glory Daze (1995)
actors: Ben Affleck, Sam Rockwell, Megan Ward, French Stewart
description: With college graduation pending, the old gang tries to avoid the inevitability of breaking up and going forward with their lives.

title: Perfect Candidate, A (1996)
actors: Don Baker, Mark Goodin, Mark Merritt, Peter Baker
description: The filmmakers follow Oliver North's unsuccessful 1994 bid for a Virginia Senate seat, focusing on North's campaign strategist, Mark Goodin, and a Washington Post reporter. Mudslinging ensues.

title: On Golden Pond (1981)
actors: Katharine Hepburn, Henry Fonda, Jane Fonda, Doug McKeon
description: Norman is a curmudgeon with an estranged relationship with his daughter Chelsea. At Golden Pond, he and his wife nevertheless agree to care for Billy, the son of Chelsea's new boyfriend, and a most unexpected relationship blooms.

title: Return of the Pink Panther, The (1975)
actors: Peter Sellers, Christopher Plummer, Catherine Schell, Herbert Lom
description: Inspector Jacque Clouseau (Peter Sellers) is put on the case when the Pink Panther diamond is stolen, with the Phantom's trademark glove the only clue.

title: Drop Dead Fred (1991)
actors: Phoebe Cates, Rik Mayall, Marsha Mason, Tim Matheson
description: A young woman finds her already unstable life rocked by the presence of a rambunctious imaginary friend from childhood.

title: Abyss, The (1989)
actors: Ed Harris, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Michael Biehn, Leo Burmester
description: A civilian diving team is enlisted to search for a lost nuclear submarine and faces danger while encountering an alien aquatic species.

title: Fog, The (1980)
actors: Adrienne Barbeau, Jamie Lee Curtis, Janet Leigh, John Houseman
description: An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters.

title: Escape from New York (1981)
actors: Kurt Russell, Lee Van Cleef, Ernest Borgnine, Donald Pleasence

title: Howling, The (1980)
actors: Dee Wallace, Patrick Macnee, Dennis Dugan, Christopher Stone
description: After a bizarre and near deadly encounter with a serial killer, a television newswoman is sent to a remote mountain resort whose residents may not be what they seem.

title: Jean de Florette (1986)
actors: Yves Montand, Gérard Depardieu, Daniel Auteuil, Elisabeth Depardieu
description: A greedy landowner and his backward nephew conspire to block the only water source for an adjoining property in order to bankrupt the owner and force him to sell.

title: Manon of the Spring (Manon des sources) (1986)
actors: Yves Montand, Daniel Auteuil, Emmanuelle Béart, Hippolyte Girardot

title: Private Benjamin (1980)
actors: Goldie Hawn, Eileen Brennan, Armand Assante, Robert Webber
description: A sheltered young high-society woman joins the United States Army on a whim and finds herself in a trickier situation than she ever expected.

title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail (1975)
actors: Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle, Terry Gilliam
description: King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table embark on a surreal, low-budget search for the Holy Grail, encountering many, very silly obstacles.

title: Hustler White (1996)
actors: Tony Ward, Bruce La Bruce, Kevin P. Scott, Ivar Johnson

title: Entertaining Angels: The Dorothy Day Story (1996)
actors: Moira Kelly, Martin Sheen, Lenny von Dohlen, Melinda Dillon
description: Chronicles the life of Dorothy Day who dedicated herself in service to her socialist beliefs and her adopted faith of Catholicism. The movement she created continues to thrive to this day, with more than 200 communities across the United States and another 28 communities abroad. The title of the movie is taken from a phrase which means to treat all guests, whether they be kings or peasants, like they were visiting angels.

title: Line King: The Al Hirschfeld Story, The (1996)
actors: Julie Andrews, Lauren Bacall, Carol Channing, Cy Coleman

title: When We Were Kings (1996)
actors: Muhammad Ali, George Foreman, Don King, James Brown
description: Boxing documentary on the 1974 world heavyweight championship bout between defending champion, George Foreman, and the underdog challenger, Muhammad Ali.

title: Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers (1993)
actors: Peter Sallis
description: Gromit butts heads with a mysterious penguin lodger, who hatches a sinister scheme involving the ex-NASA Techno Trousers that have been modified by Wallace for walkies.

title: Return of Martin Guerre, The (Retour de Martin Guerre, Le) (1982)
actors: Gérard Depardieu, Nathalie Baye, Maurice Barrier, Bernard-Pierre Donnadieu
description: In medieval France, some villagers challenge a man's claim of identity when he (as he says) returns home from some time in the army.

title: Lesson Faust (1994)
actors: Petr Cepek, Jan Kraus, Vladimír Kudla, Antonin Zacpal
description: An ordinary man is lured into a strange puppet theatre by a map and finds himself embroiled in a production of the Faustian legend.

title: Children Are Watching Us, The (Bambini ci guardano, I) (1944)
actors: Emilio Cigoli, Luciano De Ambrosis, Isa Pola, Adriano Rimoldi
description: Four-year-old Pricò becomes the subject of emotional folly by his capricious parents and negligent relatives.

title: Tin Drum, The (Blechtrommel, Die) (1979)
actors: Mario Adorf, Angela Winkler, David Bennent, Katharina Thalbach
description: In 1924, Oskar Matzerath is born in the Free City of Danzig. At age three, he falls down a flight of stairs and stops growing. In 1939, World War II breaks out.

title: Ruling Class, The (1972)

title: Mina Tannenbaum (1994)
actors: Romane Bohringer, Elsa Zylberstein, Florence Thomassin, Jean-Philippe Écoffey

title: Best of the Best 3: No Turning Back (1995)

title: Cinema Paradiso (Nuovo cinema Paradiso) (1989)
actors: Antonella Attili, Enzo Cannavale, Isa Danieli, Leo Gullotta

title: Cook the Thief His Wife & Her Lover, The (1989)

title: Delicatessen (1991)
actors: Pascal Benezech, Dominique Pinon, Marie-Laure Dougnac, Jean-Claude Dreyfus

title: Double Life of Veronique, The (Double Vie de Véronique, La) (1991)

title: Enchanted April (1992)
actors: Josie Lawrence, Miranda Richardson, Alfred Molina, Neville Phillips

title: Paths of Glory (1957)
actors: Kirk Douglas, Ralph Meeker, Adolphe Menjou, George Macready
description: After refusing to attack an enemy position, a general accuses the soldiers of cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.

title: Grifters, The (1990)
actors: Anjelica Huston, John Cusack, Annette Bening, Jan Munroe
description: A small-time conman has torn loyalties between his estranged mother and new girlfriend, both of whom are high-stakes grifters with their own angles to play.

title: Hear My Song (1991)
actors: Brian Flanagan, Constance Cowley, Marie Mullen, Phil Kelly

title: English Patient, The (1996)

title: Mediterraneo (1991)
actors: Diego Abatantuono, Claudio Bigagli, Giuseppe Cederna, Claudio Bisio

title: My Left Foot (1989)
actors: Daniel Day-Lewis, Brenda Fricker, Alison Whelan, Kirsten Sheridan

title: Sex, Lies, and Videotape (1989)
actors: James Spader, Andie MacDowell, Peter Gallagher, Laura San Giacomo

actors: Mary McDonnell, Angela Bassett, Lenore Banks, William Mahoney
description: After an accident leaves her a paraplegic, a former soap opera star struggles to recover both emotionally and mentally, until she meets her newest nurse, who has struggles of her own.

title: Strictly Ballroom (1992)
actors: Paul Mercurio, Tara Morice, Bill Hunter, Pat Thomson
description: A maverick dancer risks his career by performing an unusual routine and sets out to succeed with a new partner.

title: Thin Blue Line, The (1988)
actors: Randall Adams, David Harris, Gus Rose, Jackie Johnson
description: A film that successfully argued that a man was wrongly convicted for murder by a corrupt justice system in Dallas County, Texas.

title: Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down! (¡Átame!) (1990)
actors: Victoria Abril, Antonio Banderas, Loles León, María Barranco
description: An unbalanced but alluring former mental patient takes a porn star prisoner in the hopes of convincing her to marry him.

title: Madonna: Truth or Dare (1991)
actors: Madonna, Donna DeLory, Niki Haris, Luis Camacho
description: Documentary following singer Madonna on her controversial Blond Ambition tour in 1990.

title: Paris Is Burning (1990)
actors: Brooke Xtravaganza, André Christian, Dorian Corey, Paris Duprée

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest (1975)
actors: Michael Berryman, Peter Brocco, Dean R. Brooks, Alonzo Brown

title: Cheech and Chong's Up in Smoke (1978)
actors: Cheech Marin, Tommy Chong, Strother Martin, Edie Adams

title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back (1980)
actors: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Billy Dee Williams
description: After the Rebels are overpowered by the Empire, Luke Skywalker begins his Jedi training with Yoda, while his friends are pursued across the galaxy by Darth Vader and bounty hunter Boba Fett.

title: Princess Bride, The (1987)
actors: Cary Elwes, Mandy Patinkin, Chris Sarandon, Christopher Guest
description: A bedridden boy's grandfather reads him the story of a farmboy-turned-pirate who encounters numerous obstacles, enemies and allies in his quest to be reunited with his true love.

title: Raiders of the Lost Ark (Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark) (1981)
actors: Harrison Ford, Karen Allen, Paul Freeman, Ronald Lacey
description: In 1936, archaeologist and adventurer Indiana Jones is hired by the U.S. government to find the Ark of the Covenant before the Nazis can obtain its awesome powers.

title: Brazil (1985)
actors: Jonathan Pryce, Robert De Niro, Katherine Helmond, Ian Holm

Meanwhile, David Huffman and Mariana Hill are once-almost-married old friends, reunited over the death of her mother on the beach, and searching for clues in the abandoned buildings where they used to play when they were young.

title: Hearts and Minds (1996)
actors: Danny Keogh, Patrick Shai, Seputla Sebogodi, Brian O'Shaughnessy
description: Set when the apartheid government was still in control, this powerful South African thriller is based on the true story of a policeman belonging to an elite government squad who was assigned to masquerade as a supporter and infiltrate the African National Congress so he could assassinate their leaders. Fourie is the cop, and his squadron is the most notoriously racist unit of the S.A. police force; they were infamous for donning street clothes, putting on blackface makeup, and driving around in unmarked cars to kill people and cause trouble to encourage fighting amongst rival groups. Although the ANC members are initially suspicious of Fourie, eventually they accept him and send him to be trained in Lusaka, Zambia, and other places. They even send him to Moscow where he learns about Marxist philosophies. By the time Fourie completes all that training, the conflict has ended, Mandela is released, and his squadron has split up and melted into the general populace.
