description: A man learns he has a thirteen-year-old son who was raised in the jungle and brings the boy to New York City, turning his life upside down in the process.

title: Kama Sutra: A Tale of Love (1996)
actors: Indira Varma, Sarita Choudhury, Ramon Tikaram, Naveen Andrews
description: Two female friends become sexual rivals at maturity.

title: Private Parts (1997)
actors: Howard Stern, Robin Quivers, Mary McCormack, Fred Norris
description: The autobiographical story of Howard Stern, the radio rebel who is now also a TV personality, an author and a movie star.

title: Love Jones (1997)
actors: Larenz Tate, Nia Long, Isaiah Washington, Lisa Nicole Carson
description: Darius Lovehall is a young black poet in Chicago who starts dating Nina Mosley, a beautiful and talented photographer. While trying to figure out if they've got a "love thing" or are just "kicking it," they hang out with their friend, talking about love and sex. Then Nina tests the strength of Darius' feelings and sets a chain of romantic complications into motion.

title: Saint, The (1997)
actors: Val Kilmer, Elisabeth Shue, Rade Serbedzija, Valeriy Nikolaev
description: Simon Templar (The Saint), is a thief for hire, whose latest job to steal the secret process for cold fusion puts him at odds with a traitor bent on toppling the Russian government, as well as the woman who holds its secret.

title: Smilla's Sense of Snow (1997)
actors: Jens Jørgen Fleischer, Julia Ormond, Agga Olsen, Patrick Field
description: A 6 y.o. Inuit boy runs off a snowy roof in Copenhagen and dies. Smilla, a half Inuit who lives in the building and knows the boy, looks into it. What makes an acrophobic boy run up on the roof? The clues take her to Greenland.

title: Crash (1996)
actors: James Spader, Holly Hunter, Elias Koteas, Deborah Kara Unger
description: After getting into a serious car accident, a TV director discovers an underground sub-culture of scarred, omnisexual car-crash victims who use car accidents and the raw sexual energy they produce to try to rejuvenate his sex life with his wife.

title: Daytrippers, The (1996)
actors: Stanley Tucci, Hope Davis, Pat McNamara, Anne Meara
description: When she discovers a love letter written to her husband by an unknown paramour, the distraught Eliza turns to her tight-knit Long Island family for advice.

title: Liar Liar (1997)
actors: Jim Carrey, Maura Tierney, Justin Cooper, Cary Elwes
description: A pathological liar-lawyer finds his career turned upside down when he inexplicably cannot physically lie for 24 whole hours.

title: Selena (1997)
actors: Jennifer Lopez, Jackie Guerra, Constance Marie, Alex Meneses
description: The true story of Selena, a Texas-born Tejano singer who rose from cult status to performing at the Astrodome, as well as having chart-topping albums on the Latin music charts.

title: Devil's Own, The (1997)
actors: Harrison Ford, Brad Pitt, Margaret Colin, Rubén Blades
description: A police officer uncovers the real identity of his house-guest, an I.R.A. terrorist in hiding.

title: Cats Don't Dance (1997)
actors: Scott Bakula, Jasmine Guy, Natalie Cole, Ashley Peldon
description: Danny, an ambitious singing and dancing cat, goes to Hollywood and overcomes several obstacles to fulfill his dream of becoming a movie star.

title: B*A*P*S (1997)
actors: Halle Berry, Martin Landau, Ian Richardson, Natalie Desselle Reid
description: Two tacky homegirls move to L.A. to become dancers; instead they scam a dying millionaire but eventually become B*A*P*S (Black American Princesses).

title: Love and Other Catastrophes (1996)
actors: Matt Day, Matthew Dyktynski, Alice Garner, Frances O'Connor
description: A day in the life of two film-school students trying to find love and another house-mate.

title: Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie (1997)
actors: Jon Simanton, Kai Doi, Greg Collins, Steve Cardenas
description: A space alien is threatening to bring destruction on Earth, and the Power Rangers are enhanced with turbo powers in order to prevent her plan.

title: Anna Karenina (1997)
actors: Sophie Marceau, Sean Bean, Alfred Molina, Mia Kirshner
description: Anna (Marceau) is a wife and mother who has an affair with the handsome Count Vronsky (Bean). Based on the novel by Tolstoy.

title: Double Team (1997)
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dennis Rodman, Mickey Rourke, Paul Freeman
description: An international spy teams up with an arms dealer to escape from a penal colony and rescue his family from a terrorist.

title: Inventing the Abbotts (1997)
actors: Joaquin Phoenix, Billy Crudup, Will Patton, Kathy Baker
description: Two working class brothers court three wealthy and beautiful sisters in a small Illinois town.

title: Anaconda (1997)
actors: Jennifer Lopez, Ice Cube, Jon Voight, Eric Stoltz
description: A "National Geographic" film crew is taken hostage by an insane hunter, who forces them along on his quest to capture the world's largest - and deadliest - snake.

title: Grosse Pointe Blank (1997)
actors: John Cusack, Minnie Driver, Alan Arkin, Dan Aykroyd
description: Martin Blank is a professional assassin. He is sent on a mission to a small Detroit suburb, Grosse Pointe, and, by coincidence, his ten-year high school reunion party is taking place there at the same time.

title: Kissed (1996)
actors: Molly Parker, Peter Outerbridge, Jay Brazeau, Natasha Morley
description: Over the years, a child's romantic ideals about death blossom into necrophilia, the study of embalming and the most profound relationship of her life.

title: 8 Heads in a Duffel Bag (1997)
actors: Joe Pesci, Andy Comeau, Kristy Swanson, George Hamilton
description: A mob bagman finds that his luggage, containing the proof of his gang's latest hit, has been switched.

title: Paradise Road (1997)
actors: Glenn Close, Frances McDormand, Pauline Collins, Cate Blanchett
description: A group of women who are imprisoned on the island of Sumatra by the Japanese during World War II use music to relieve their misery.

title: Romy and Michele's High School Reunion (1997)
actors: Mira Sorvino, Lisa Kudrow, Janeane Garofalo, Alan Cumming
description: Two dim-witted, inseparable friends hit the road for their ten-year high school reunion and concoct an elaborate lie about their lives in order to impress their classmates.

title: Temptress Moon (Feng Yue) (1996)
actors: Leslie Cheung, Gong Li, Kevin Lin, Saifei He
description: Not far from Shanghai, in a country town stands the palatial home of the Pang family. Old Master Pang is an addict who brings up his beautiful daughter Ruyi on opium smoke. Her older brother, Zhengda, is addicted as well, and then paralysed and effectively brain-dead. Zhongliang, Zhengda's brother-in-law, is a successful gigolo in Shanghai who seduces older married women and then blackmails them. When Older Master Pang dies, the clan elders make Ruyi take over the role as the head of the household. Zhongliang returns to the Pang family on the death of Old Master Pang, re-encounters Ruyi, and they are secretly attracted to each other. Wanting to seem sophisticated, she succumbs to Zhongliang's attempts to seduce her. But then an emotional maelstrom follows - for the angry, jealous and sexually frustrated sister (Zhengda's wife) is also part of the picture.

title: Volcano (1997)
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Anne Heche, Gaby Hoffmann, Don Cheadle
description: A volcano erupts in downtown Los Angeles and a city official and a seismologist try to stop its inevitable flow through the city.

title: Children of the Revolution (1996)
actors: Judy Davis, Sam Neill, F. Murray Abraham, Richard Roxburgh
description: Few knew that Stalin spent his last night in the arms of a young Australian woman. Few still knew that their "love-child" brought Australia to the brink of civil war. Until now.

title: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery (1997)
actors: Mike Myers, Elizabeth Hurley, Michael York, Mimi Rogers
description: A world-class playboy and part-time secret agent from the 1960s emerges after thirty years in a cryogenic state to battle with his nemesis Dr. Evil.

title: Breakdown (1997)
actors: Kurt Russell, J. T. Walsh, Kathleen Quinlan, M. C. Gainey
description: A man searches for his missing wife after his car breaks down in the middle of the desert.

title: Broken English (1996)
actors: Rade Serbedzija, Aleksandra Vujcic, Julian Arahanga, Marton Csokas
description: Ivan is the fierce patriarch of a family of Croatian refugees in Auckland. Nina is his daughter, ready to live on her own, despite his angry objections. Eddie is the Maori she takes as her lover. Nina works at a restaurant where Eddie cooks. For a price, she agrees to marry a Chinese, another restaurant employee, so that he (and his Chinese wife) can establish permanent residency. The money gives her the independence she needs to leave her parents' house and move in with Eddie. Complications arise when Eddie realizes the depth of her father's fury and the strength of Nina's family ties.

title: Fathers' Day (1997)
actors: Robin Williams, Billy Crystal, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Nastassja Kinski
description: A woman cons two old boyfriends into searching for her runaway son by convincing both that they are the boy's father.

title: Fifth Element, The (1997)
actors: Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Ian Holm, Milla Jovovich
description: In the colorful future, a cab driver unwittingly becomes the central figure in the search for a legendary cosmic weapon to keep Evil and Mr. Zorg at bay.

title: Nowhere (1997)
actors: James Duval, Rachel True, Nathan Bexton, Chiara Mastroianni
description: Follows a day in the lives of a group of Los Angeles high school students and the strange lives they lead.

title: Promise, The (La promesse) (1996)
actors: Jérémie Renier, Olivier Gourmet, Assita Ouedraogo, Jean-Michel Balthazar
description: Roger uses his son Igor to ruthlessly traffic and exploit undocumented immigrants. When one of the immigrants is killed, Igor is guilt-ridden and wants to care for the dead man's family against his father's orders.

title: Shall We Dance? (Shall We Dansu?) (1996)
actors: Kôji Yakusho, Tamiyo Kusakari, Naoto Takenaka, Eri Watanabe
description: A successful but unhappy Japanese accountant finds the missing passion in his life when he begins to secretly take ballroom dance lessons.

title: Addicted to Love (1997)
actors: Meg Ryan, Matthew Broderick, Kelly Preston, Tchéky Karyo
description: Maggie's and Sam's former partners are in love; she wants revenge and he wants his lost love back, so they work together to break up the happy couple.

title: Brassed Off (1996)
actors: Pete Postlethwaite, Tara Fitzgerald, Ewan McGregor, Stephen Tompkinson
description: The coal mine in a northern English village may be closing, which would also mean the end of the miners' brass band.

title: Lost World: Jurassic Park, The (1997)
actors: Jeff Goldblum, Julianne Moore, Pete Postlethwaite, Arliss Howard
description: A research team is sent to the Jurassic Park Site B island to study the dinosaurs there, while an InGen team approaches with another agenda.

title: Ponette (1996)
actors: Victoire Thivisol, Delphine Schiltz, Matiaz Bureau Caton, Léopoldine Serre
description: A four-year-old girl tries to come to terms with the sudden death of her mother.

title: Schizopolis (1996)
actors: Scott Allen, Betsy Brantley, Marcus Lyle Brown, Joe Chrest
description: Fletcher Munson, the lethargic employee of a pseudo-religious self help company, and his doppelganger, the friendly but dull dentist Dr. Jeffrey Korchek.

title: Shiloh (1997)
actors: Scott Wilson, Blake Heron, Bonnie Bartlett, Rod Steiger
description: A small-town Southern boy named Marty Preston must rescue a young beagle from his abusive owner, Judd Travers.

title: Rough Magic (1995)
actors: Bridget Fonda, Russell Crowe, Jim Broadbent, D. W. Moffett
description: Set in the 1950s, Rough Magic tells the story of what happens when a pretty apprentice magician goes to Mexico to escape her fiancé, a wealthy politician, and to find a Mayan shaman who will teach her ancient principles of magic. She is being trailed by a detective hired by her fiancé. He's a former photojournalist traumatized by what he saw in Hiroshima. The photojournalist joins her in the search for the Mayan shaman, and falls in love with her; the feeling is not reciprocated. When she finds the shaman, she drinks a potion which empowers her to do magic. The potion has life-changing effects on her and her relationship with her companion. They have strange experiences which are brought about by magic.

title: Trial and Error (1997)
actors: Michael Richards, Jeff Daniels, Charlize Theron, Jessica Steen
description: An actor poses as a lawyer to help his sick friend, and problems develop.

title: Buddy (1997)
actors: Rene Russo, Robbie Coltrane, Alan Cumming, Irma P. Hall
description: A depiction of the true life story of Gertrude Lintz, an eccentric 1920's socialite who tries to raise a gorilla, like many chimps before him, as part of her family.

title: Con Air (1997)
actors: Colm Meaney, Mykelti Williamson, Nick Chinlund, Renoly Santiago
description: Newly-paroled ex-con and former U.S. Ranger Cameron Poe finds himself trapped in a prisoner-transport plane when the passengers seize control.

title: Pillow Book, The (1996)
actors: Vivian Wu, Yoshi Oida, Ken Ogata, Hideko Yoshida
description: A woman with a body-writing fetish seeks to find a combined lover and calligrapher.

title: Speed 2: Cruise Control (1997)
actors: Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric, Willem Dafoe, Temuera Morrison
description: A computer hacker breaks into the computer system of the Seabourn Legend cruise liner and sets it speeding on a collision course into a gigantic oil tanker.

title: Batman & Robin (1997)
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, George Clooney, Chris O'Donnell, Uma Thurman
description: Batman and Robin try to keep their relationship together even as they must stop Mr. Freeze and Poison Ivy from freezing Gotham City.

title: For Roseanna (Roseanna's Grave) (1997)
actors: Jean Reno, Mercedes Ruehl, Polly Walker, Mark Frankel
description: Roseanna is dying of a heart condition, and all she wants is to be buried next to her daughter, in a cemetery that is getting full fast. The cemetery can't expand because Capestro, the man who owns the land next to the cemetery, won't sell. While Marcello is doing good deeds to make sure no one dies, Roseanna thinks of Marcello's future.

title: Head Above Water (1996)
actors: Harvey Keitel, Cameron Diaz, Craig Sheffer, Billy Zane
description: A prominent judge, his wife, her ex-lover, and their neighbor encounter a dead body that complicates their lives.

title: Hercules (1997)
actors: Barbara Barrie, Roger Bart, Mary Kay Bergman, Corey Burton
description: The son of Zeus and Hera is stripped of his immortality as an infant and must become a true hero in order to reclaim it.

title: My Best Friend's Wedding (1997)
actors: Julia Roberts, Dermot Mulroney, Cameron Diaz, Rupert Everett
description: When a woman's long-time friend reveals he's engaged, she realizes she loves him herself and sets out to get him, with only days before the wedding.

title: When the Cat's Away (Chacun cherche son chat) (1996)
actors: Garance Clavel, Zinedine Soualem, Renée Le Calm, Olivier Py
description: Chloe, a young woman, is going on holidays. She entrusts her beloved cat to Madame Renée's care. But one day Madame Renée (an old lady of the neighborhood) can not find the cat. Chloe starts searching the neighborhood... This is the pretext for the exploration of a quarter of Paris and his inhabitants.

title: Contempt (Mépris, Le) (1963)
actors: Brigitte Bardot, Michel Piccoli, Jack Palance, Giorgia Moll

title: Face/Off (1997)

description: To foil a terrorist plot, an FBI agent undergoes facial transplant surgery to assume the identity of the criminal mastermind who murdered his only son, but the criminal wakes up prematurely and seeks revenge.

title: Fall (1997)
actors: Eric Schaeffer, Amanda De Cadenet, Rudolf Martin, Francie Swift
description: Cab driver Michael and supermodel Sarah fall in love while her gorgeous husband Phillippe is in Madrid for two months.

title: Men in Black (a.k.a. MIB) (1997)
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio
description: A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.

title: Out to Sea (1997)
actors: Jack Lemmon, Walter Matthau, Dyan Cannon, Gloria DeHaven
description: A failed gambler, intent on meeting a rich widow, tricks his widowed brother-in-law into boarding a cruise ship as dance hosts.

title: Wild America (1997)
actors: Jonathan Taylor Thomas, Devon Sawa, Scott Bairstow, Frances Fisher
description: Three brothers who are obsessed with animals are given permission from their parents to travel around America with a camera documenting wildlife.

title: Simple Wish, A (1997)
actors: Robert Pastorelli, Ruby Dee, Francis Capra, Jonathan Hadary
description: A bumbling fairy godfather tries to grant a girl's wish that her cabby father lands a Broadway role.

title: Contact (1997)
actors: Jena Malone, David Morse, Jodie Foster, Geoffrey Blake
description: Dr. Ellie Arroway, after years of searching, finds conclusive radio proof of extraterrestrial intelligence, sending plans for a mysterious machine.

title: Love Serenade (1996)
actors: Miranda Otto, Rebecca Frith, George Shevtsov, John Alansu
description: In Sunray, a backwater town on Australia's Murray River, there's little to do but fish or listen to the local radio station. D.J. Ken Sherry arrives from the hustle of Brisbane to run the station; he's mid-40s, detached, thrice divorced, hatchet faced. But both sisters next door find him attractive: awkward Dimity, only 20, who works in a Chinese restaurant with few patrons, and perky Vicki-Ann, a hairdresser with a hope chest who invents a happy future with Sherry based on little but his arrival. First Dimity then Vicki-Ann spend the night with Ken, one concluding he's her boy friend, the other her fiance. Then Dimity begins to smell something fishy.

title: G.I. Jane (1997)
actors: Demi Moore, Viggo Mortensen, Anne Bancroft, Jason Beghe

title: Conan the Barbarian (1982)
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, James Earl Jones, Max von Sydow, Sandahl Bergman
description: A young boy, Conan, becomes a slave after his parents are killed and tribe destroyed by a savage warlord and sorcerer, Thulsa Doom. When he grows up he becomes a fearless, invincible fighter. Set free, he plots revenge against Thulsa Doom.

title: George of the Jungle (1997)
actors: Brendan Fraser, Leslie Mann, Thomas Haden Church, Richard Roundtree
description: A man raised in the jungle by apes falls in love with a wealthy American heiress.

title: Cop Land (1997)
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta, Robert De Niro
description: The Sheriff of a suburban New Jersey community, populated by New York City police officers, slowly discovers the town is a front for mob connections and corruption.

title: Event Horizon (1997)
actors: Laurence Fishburne, Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson
description: A rescue crew investigates a spaceship that disappeared into a black hole and has now returned...with someone or something new on-board.

title: Spawn (1997)
actors: Michael Jai White, John Leguizamo, Martin Sheen, Theresa Randle
description: An elite mercenary is killed, but comes back from Hell as a reluctant soldier of the Devil.

title: Air Bud (1997)
actors: Michael Jeter, Kevin Zegers, Wendy Makkena, Bill Cobbs
description: An unexpected player joins the school basketball team - a circus dog who escaped from a cruel master.

title: Picture Perfect (1997)
actors: Jennifer Aniston, Jay Mohr, Kevin Bacon, Olympia Dukakis
description: A young advertising executive's life becomes increasingly complicated when, in order to impress her boss, she pretends to be engaged to a man she has just met.

title: In the Company of Men (1997)

title: Career Girls (1997)
actors: Katrin Cartlidge, Lynda Steadman, Kate Byers, Mark Benton

title: Conspiracy Theory (1997)
actors: Mel Gibson, Julia Roberts, Patrick Stewart, Cylk Cozart

title: Desperate Measures (1998)
actors: Michael Keaton, Andy Garcia, Brian Cox, Marcia Gay Harden
description: Frank Conner is an honest police officer who desperately needs to save his son's life. However, after losing all hope, he finds out that a criminal Peter McCabe in jail is his only savior.

title: Steel (1997)
actors: Shaquille O'Neal, Annabeth Gish, Judd Nelson, Richard Roundtree
description: A scientist for the military turns himself into a cartoon-like superhero when a version of one of his own weapons is being used against enemies.

title: She's So Lovely (1997)
actors: Robin Wright, James Gandolfini, Susan Traylor, Harry Dean Stanton
description: After being released from a psychiatric institution, a man tries to redeem himself in the eyes of his now-ex wife from the events that led up to his incarceration.

title: Hoodlum (1997)
actors: Laurence Fishburne, Tim Roth, Vanessa Williams, Andy Garcia
description: Black gangsters in 1930 Harlem fights Dutch Schultz who is trying to horn in on their numbers racket.

title: Leave It to Beaver (1997)
actors: Christopher McDonald, Janine Turner, Cameron Finley, Erik von Detten
description: The several misadventures and life-lessons learned by 8-year-old Theodore "Beaver" Cleaver in an entertaining and hilarious tale of a small-town Ohio family and the daily trials and tribunes of life.

title: Mimic (1997)
actors: Mira Sorvino, Jeremy Northam, Alexander Goodwin, Giancarlo Giannini
description: Three years ago, entomologist Dr. Susan Tyler genetically created an insect to kill cockroaches carrying a virulent disease. Now, the insects are out to destroy their only predator, mankind.

title: Money Talks (1997)
actors: Chris Tucker, Charlie Sheen, Heather Locklear, Elise Neal
description: Sought by police and criminals, a small-time huckster makes a deal with a TV newsman for protection.

title: Excess Baggage (1997)
actors: Alicia Silverstone, Benicio Del Toro, Christopher Walken, Jack Thompson
description: A bratty teenager fakes her own kidnapping, but gets mistakenly kidnapped for real instead.

title: Kull the Conqueror (1997)
actors: Kevin Sorbo, Tia Carrere, Thomas Ian Griffith, Litefoot
description: A barbarian warrior becomes a king when he defeats a king in armed combat and the king's heir conspire to overthrow him and reclaim the throne by resurrecting an evil sorceress.

title: Air Force One (1997)

description: Communist radicals hijack Air Force One with the U.S. President and his family on board. The Vice President negotiates from Washington D.C., while the President, a veteran, fights to rescue the hostages on board.

title: 187 (One Eight Seven) (1997)

description: 15 months after being stabbed 9 times by a student at work as a high school teacher in NYC, Mr. Garfield is working in LA as a substitute teacher come full-time. He refuses to be a victim anymore.

title: Hunt for Red October, The (1990)
actors: Sean Connery, Alec Baldwin, Scott Glenn, Sam Neill
description: In November 1984, the Soviet Union's best submarine captain violates orders and heads for the U.S. in a new undetectable sub. The American CIA and military must quickly determine: Is he trying to defect or to start a war?

actors: River Phoenix, Keanu Reeves, James Russo, William Richert

title: Kiss Me, Guido (1997)
actors: Nick Scotti, Anthony Barrile, Anthony DeSando, Craig Chester

Frankie, a pizza baker (and aspiring actor), decides to move out of his family's flat in The Bronx when he comes home one evening and walks in on his brother making love to Frankie's girlfriend. Frankie checks ads for roommates in "the city" (i.e., Manhattan), notices Warren's ad and decides to answer it, reasoning that GWM stands for "Guy With Money."

title: Star Maps (1997)
actors: Douglas Spain, Efrain Figueroa, Kandeyce Jorden, Martha Velez
description: Only in America. Only in Hollywood. Only in Beverly Hills could a young man with a dream make his way to the stars. Carlos is a precocious 18 year-old who returns to America from Mexico with dreams of becoming a movie star.

title: In & Out (1997)

title: Edge, The (1997)
actors: Anthony Hopkins, Alec Baldwin, Elle Macpherson, Harold Perrineau
description: An intellectual billionaire and two other men struggle to band together and survive after getting stranded in the Alaskan wilderness with a blood-thirsty Kodiak Bear hunting them down.

title: Peacemaker, The (1997)
actors: George Clooney, Nicole Kidman, Marcel Iures, Aleksandr Baluev
description: A US Army colonel and a civilian woman supervising him must track down stolen Russian nuclear weapons before they're used by terrorists.

title: L.A. Confidential (1997)
actors: Kevin Spacey, Russell Crowe, Guy Pearce, James Cromwell
description: As corruption grows in 1950s Los Angeles, three policemen - one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy - investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.

title: Seven Years in Tibet (1997)
actors: Brad Pitt, David Thewlis, BD Wong, Mako

title: Kiss the Girls (1997)
actors: Morgan Freeman, Ashley Judd, Cary Elwes, Alex McArthur
description: Police hunting for a serial kidnapper are helped when a victim manages to escape for the first time.

title: Soul Food (1997)
actors: Vanessa Williams, Vivica A. Fox, Nia Long, Michael Beach

title: Wishmaster (1997)
actors: Angus Scrimm, Ari Barak, Jake McKinnon, Greg Funk
description: A demonic djinn attempts to grant its owner three wishes, which will allow him to summon his brethren to Earth.

title: Thousand Acres, A (1997)
actors: Michelle Pfeiffer, Jessica Lange, Jason Robards, Jennifer Jason Leigh
description: A family is torn apart after a father gives his valuable farm land to his daughters.

title: Game, The (1997)
actors: Michael Douglas, Sean Penn, Deborah Kara Unger, James Rebhorn
description: After a wealthy San Francisco banker is given an opportunity to participate in a mysterious game, his life is turned upside down as he begins to question if it might really be a concealed conspiracy to destroy him.

title: Fire Down Below (1997)
actors: Steven Seagal, Marg Helgenberger, Stephen Lang, Brad Hunt
description: A federal agent uncovers lucrative toxic waste dumps in Appalachia and must deal with the locals who want to keep their 'gold mine' secret.

title: U Turn (1997)
actors: Sean Penn, Billy Bob Thornton, Abraham Benrubi, Richard Rutowski
description: A man heading to Vegas to pay off his gambling debt before the Russian mafia kills him is forced to stop in an Arizona town where everything that can go wrong does go wrong.

title: MatchMaker, The (1997)

Desperate for Irish votes, McGlory's chief of staff Nick sends Marcy to Ireland to trace McGlory's relatives or ancestors. Marcy arrives at the village of Ballinagra when it is preparing for an annual Matchmaking Festival. A well-dressed, handsome, single young lady, she becomes the center of attention for two professional matchmakers, Dermot and Millie, as well as for bartender Sean.

title: Assignment, The (1997)
actors: Aidan Quinn, Donald Sutherland, Ben Kingsley, Claudia Ferri
description: An American naval officer is recruited for an operation to eliminate his lookalike, the infamous terrorist Carlos The Jackal.

title: Ulee's Gold (1997)
actors: Peter Fonda, Patricia Richardson, Christine Dunford, Tom Wood
description: A reclusive beekeeper slowly pulls his dysfunctional family back together, but not without having to fight his son's previous dastardly cohorts.

title: Ice Storm, The (1997)
actors: Kevin Kline, Joan Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Henry Czerny
description: In suburban New Canaan, Connecticut, 1973, middle-class families experimenting with casual sex and substance abuse find their lives beyond their control.

title: Chasing Amy (1997)
actors: Ethan Suplee, Ben Affleck, Scott Mosier, Jason Lee

title: Full Monty, The (1997)
actors: Robert Carlyle, Mark Addy, Wim Snape, Steve Huison
description: Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity.

title: Indian Summer (a.k.a. Alive & Kicking) (1996)

One day, he and Judith meet in the right mood and a fragile friendship starts to grow. They can help each other to get on their feet again. But one false move could destroy everything they built so carefully.

title: Dancemaker (1998)
actors: Andrew Asnes, Rachel Berman Benz, Patrick Corbin, Ross Kramberg
description: A look at Paul Taylor (1930-2018) and his dance company over several months in 1997. Preparation of Taylor's piece, "Piazzolla Caldera," from conception and rehearsals to opening night at City Center, frames the film. The troupe's trip to India falls in the middle. Included are black and white footage of rehearsals, and, in color, interviews with Taylor, his dancers, dance critics and scholars, and those who manage the business side. There is also footage of a younger Taylor dancing and film of the troupe performing a dozen Taylor pieces. His genius, his roots, his method of working with dancers, and his sometimes difficult nature draw the attention of those who comment.

A famous master performer of the Sichuan Opera offers to bring him into his act, thus giving Wang fame and possible fortune, but Wang opts for staying the simple street performer. Then, one night after a performance he is sold a young boy by a slave trader posing as the boy's parent. "Grandpa" finds new joy in life as he plans to teach "Doggie" (an affectionate term often used for young children in China) his art. All is well until Doggie is found out to really be a girl.

description: In a time of misery and fear two enemies come together to prevent an apocalypse conspired by their leaders. 40 years of war between the Federated Republics and the New Territories Union has taken its toll. The cities are overcrowded, farming land is riddled with unexploded mines -- and still there is no hope of peace. In this hostile, decaying world of the future on thing remains constant for Lieutenant Leo Megaw; his love for his pregnant wife. Her access to classified information makes her an increasing liability for the government. When she's ambushed, Leo is forced into exile. As a border patrolman on the isolated outpost of Zone 39, ordered to kill anyone that tries to cross the border, he comes to understand that ultimate catastrophe forced upon his world by his government. The real enemy is not looming across the border but standing right behind him. Now he must reach across the border into enemy territory and form an alliance to save his world.

actors: Kirk Douglas, Laurence Olivier, Jean Simmons, Charles Laughton

actors: James Mason, Shelley Winters, Sue Lyon, Gary Cockrell

title: Barry Lyndon (1975)

title: 400 Blows, The (Les quatre cents coups) (1959)

title: Jules and Jim (Jules et Jim) (1961)
actors: Jeanne Moreau, Oskar Werner, Henri Serre, Vanna Urbino
description: Decades of a love triangle concerning two friends and an impulsive woman.

title: Vibes (1988)
actors: Ramon Bieri, Michael Lerner, Hercules Vilchez, Jerry Vichi
description: Two psychics are hired to find the location of a lost Incan city Located somewhere in the Ecuadorian mountains, that is said to hide a great treasure.

title: Mosquito Coast, The (1986)
actors: Harrison Ford, Helen Mirren, River Phoenix, Jadrien Steele
description: An inventor spurns his city life and moves his family into the jungles of Central America to make a utopia.

title: Golden Child, The (1986)
actors: J. L. Reate, Eddie Murphy, Charles Dance, Charlotte Lewis

title: Brighton Beach Memoirs (1986)
actors: Jonathan Silverman, Blythe Danner, Stacey Glick, Lisa Waltz
description: Eugene, a young teenage Jewish boy, recalls his memoirs of his time as an adolescent youth. He goes through the hardships of puberty, sexual fantasy, and living the life of a poor boy in a crowded house.

actors: Charles Bronson, Jill Ireland, Stephen Elliott, Jan Gan Boyd

title: Crimes of the Heart (1986)
actors: Diane Keaton, Jessica Lange, Sissy Spacek, Sam Shepard

title: Color Purple, The (1985)

title: Kindred, The (1986)
actors: David Allen Brooks, Rod Steiger, Amanda Pays, Talia Balsam
description: A geneticist takes his assistants to his old family home to locate the deadly product of his late mother's revolutionary research into rapid human evolution - his monstrous tentacled baby brother - before a mad scientist gets to him first.

title: No Mercy (1986)
actors: Richard Gere, Kim Basinger, Jeroen Krabbé, George Dzundza
description: A Chicago detective, seeking to avenge his partner's death, travels to New Orleans, where he unexpectedly becomes involved in a cat and mouse game of survival.

title: Ménage (Tenue de soirée) (1986)
actors: Gérard Depardieu, Michel Blanc, Miou-Miou, Michel Creton
description: A bisexual petty criminal named Bob encounters a married couple arguing in a bar. Bob breaks up the fight and proceeds to seduce first the wife and then the husband. Then Bob teaches the couple how to be burglars and they join him in his criminal exploits.

title: Native Son (1986)
actors: Victor Love, Matt Dillon, Elizabeth McGovern, Geraldine Page
description: In 1940s Chicago, a young black man takes a job as a chauffeur to a white family, which takes a turn for the worse when he accidentally kills the teenage daughter of the couple and then tries to cover it up.

title: Otello (1986)
actors: Plácido Domingo, Katia Ricciarelli, Justino Díaz, Petra Malakova
description: Verdi's famous opera is brought to life in this production. The immortal tale of the noble Moor and his beautiful young wife, and of his lieutenant, whose jealousy and lust for power lead him to commit the ultimate treason.

title: Mission, The (1986)
actors: Robert De Niro, Jeremy Irons, Ray McAnally, Aidan Quinn
description: Eighteenth-century Spanish Jesuits try to protect a remote South American tribe in danger of falling under the rule of pro-slavery Portugal.

title: Little Shop of Horrors (1986)
actors: Levi Stubbs, Rick Moranis, Ellen Greene, Vincent Gardenia
description: A nerdy florist finds his chance for success and romance with the help of a giant man-eating plant who demands to be fed.

title: Little Shop of Horrors, The (1960)
actors: Jonathan Haze, Jackie Joseph, Mel Welles, Dick Miller
description: A clumsy young man nurtures a plant and discovers that it's carnivorous, forcing him to kill to feed it.

title: Allan Quatermain and the Lost City of Gold (1987)
actors: Richard Chamberlain, Sharon Stone, James Earl Jones, Henry Silva
description: Allan Quatermain once again teams up with Jesse Huston where the discovery of a mysterious old gold piece sends Quatermain looking for his long-lost brother, missing in the wilds of Africa after seeking a lost white race.

title: Morning After, The (1986)
actors: Jane Fonda, Jeff Bridges, Raul Julia, Diane Salinger

title: Radio Days (1987)
actors: Mike Starr, Paul Herman, Don Pardo, Martin Rosenblatt
description: A nostalgic look at radio's golden age focusing on one ordinary family and the various performers in the medium.

title: From the Hip (1987)
actors: Judd Nelson, Elizabeth Perkins, John Hurt, Darren McGavin
description: Robin, one year out of law school with one trial, gets set up with an unwinnable murder case for having forced his law firm to make him partner with unethical behavior, tarnishing the firm.

title: Outrageous Fortune (1987)
actors: Shelley Long, Bette Midler, Peter Coyote, Robert Prosky
description: Two women unknowingly share the same man, but when he disappears, both go out looking for him and enter his surprisingly dangerous life.

title: Deadtime Stories (1987)
actors: Scott Valentine, Nicole Picard, Matt Mitler, Cathryn de Prume
description: A babysitting uncle tells his nephew three horror stories about killer witches, Little Red Riding Hood and a werewolf, and "Goldi Lox" and the three bears.

title: Frances (1982)
actors: Jonathan Banks, Bonnie Bartlett, James Brodhead, Bart Burns
description: The story of Frances Farmer's meteoric rise to fame in Hollywood and the tragic turn her life took when she was blacklisted.

title: Dick (1999)
actors: Kirsten Dunst, Michelle Williams, Dan Hedaya, Will Ferrell
description: After wandering off during a White House tour, two high school girls inadvertently become Richard Nixon's top secret advisers at the height of the Watergate scandal.

title: Iron Giant, The (1999)
actors: Jennifer Aniston, Harry Connick Jr. , Vin Diesel, James Gammon
description: A young boy befriends a giant robot from outer space that a paranoid government agent wants to destroy.

title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
actors: Bruce Willis, Haley Joel Osment, Toni Collette, Olivia Williams
description: A frightened, withdrawn Philadelphia boy who communicates with spirits seeks the help of a disheartened child psychologist.

title: Thomas Crown Affair, The (1999)
actors: Pierce Brosnan, Rene Russo, Denis Leary, Ben Gazzara
description: A very rich and successful playboy amuses himself by stealing artwork, but may have met his match in a seductive detective.

title: Thomas Crown Affair, The (1968)
actors: Steve McQueen, Faye Dunaway, Paul Burke, Jack Weston
description: A debonair, adventuresome bank executive believes he has pulled off the perfect multi-million dollar heist, only to match wits with a sexy insurance investigator who will do anything to get her man.

title: Acid House, The (1998)
actors: Stephen McCole, Maurice Roëves, Garry Sweeney, Jenny McCrindle
description: Three twisted tales of abuse, drugs, displaced personalities, and insect life by Scottish writer Irvine Welsh.

title: Adventures of Sebastian Cole, The (1998)
actors: Adrian Grenier, Clark Gregg, Aleksa Palladino, Margaret Colin
description: In June, 1983, in Dutchess County, New York, Sebastian Cole joins his mother, step-father, and sister for dinner. Hank, Sebastian's step-father, drops a bomb: he announces he's changing sexes. Sebastian's sister splits immediately for California, and his mother takes him back to England. Jump ahead eight months, Sebastian is back in New York, knocking on Hank's door. Hank (now Henrietta, although all the surgeries aren't complete) takes Sebastian in and is his rock over the next few months of high school. Sebastian's "adventures" are mostly self-destructive.

title: Yards, The (2000)
actors: Mark Wahlberg, Joaquin Phoenix, Charlize Theron, James Caan
description: Leo is released from prison after serving time for car theft. His plan to go straight falls apart when he meets his corrupt uncle for a job and later an old friend working there. It culminates at the (railroad) yards.

title: Bowfinger (1999)
actors: Steve Martin, Eddie Murphy, Heather Graham, Christine Baranski
description: When a desperate movie producer fails to get a major star for his bargain-basement film, he decides to shoot the film secretly around him.

title: Brokedown Palace (1999)
actors: Claire Danes, Kate Beckinsale, Bill Pullman, Jacqueline Kim
description: Two women are arrested for smuggling while vacationing in Thailand.

title: Detroit Rock City (1999)
actors: Giuseppe Andrews, James DeBello, Edward Furlong, Sam Huntington
description: In 1978, four rebellious teenagers try to scam their way into a KISS concert.

title: Better Than Chocolate (1999)
actors: Wendy Crewson, Karyn Dwyer, Christina Cox, Ann-Marie MacDonald
description: Maggie, 19, works at a lesbian/LGBT bookstore. Her mom's getting divorced and has invited herself to stay with Maggie. Maggie hasn't told her, she's lesbian. Her new girlfriend moves in as well.

title: Head On (1998)
actors: Alex Dimitriades, Elle Mandalis, Damien Fotiou, Alex Papps
description: A 19 year old Greek Australian youth struggles with his sexual identity and has one clumsy heterosexual and several homosexual encounters.

title: Heaven Can Wait (1978)
actors: Warren Beatty, Julie Christie, James Mason, Jack Warden
description: A Los Angeles Rams quarterback, accidentally taken away from his body by an overanxious angel before he was meant to die, returns to life in the body of a recently murdered millionaire.

title: Pit and the Pendulum (1961)
actors: Vincent Price, John Kerr, Barbara Steele, Luana Anders
description: In the sixteenth century, Francis Barnard travels to Spain to clarify the strange circumstances of his sister's death after she had married the son of a cruel Spanish Inquisitor.

title: Masque of the Red Death, The (1964)
actors: Vincent Price, Hazel Court, Jane Asher, David Weston
description: A European prince terrorizes the local peasantry while using his castle as a refuge against the "Red Death" plague that stalks the land.

title: Haunted Honeymoon (1986)
actors: Gene Wilder, Gilda Radner, Dom DeLuise, Jonathan Pryce
description: Two radio voice actors are getting married. Larry has fits of fear. A shrink needs 36 hours to scare him to death and cure him - during a family reunion at a scary family castle.

title: Cat's Eye (1985)
actors: Drew Barrymore, James Woods, Alan King, Kenneth McMillan
description: A stray cat is the linking element of three tales of suspense and horror.

title: Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different (1971)
actors: Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Terry Gilliam, Eric Idle
description: An anthology of the best sketches from the first and second seasons of Монти Пайтон: Летающий цирк (1969).

title: Damien: Omen II (1978)
actors: William Holden, Lee Grant, Jonathan Scott-Taylor, Robert Foxworth
description: Damien the Antichrist, now about to turn thirteen years old, finally learns of his destiny under the guidance of an unholy disciple of Satan. Meanwhile dark forces begin to eliminate all those who suspect the child's true identity.

title: Final Conflict, The (a.k.a. Omen III: The Final Conflict) (1981)
actors: Sam Neill, Rossano Brazzi, Don Gordon, Lisa Harrow
description: The now adult Antichrist plots to eliminate his future divine opponent while a cabal of monks plot to stop him.

title: Airplane! (1980)
director: Jim Abrahams, David Zucker, Jerry Zucker
actors: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Lloyd Bridges, Peter Graves, Julie Hagerty
description: After the crew becomes sick with food poisoning, a neurotic ex-fighter pilot must land a commercial airplane full of passengers safely.

title: Airplane II: The Sequel (1982)
actors: Lloyd Bridges, Raymond Burr, Chuck Connors, Rip Torn
description: A faulty computer causes a passenger space shuttle to head straight for the Sun. Can Ted Striker save the day and get the shuttle back on track - again?

title: American Werewolf in Paris, An (1997)
actors: Tom Everett Scott, Julie Delpy, Vince Vieluf, Phil Buckman
description: An American man unwittingly gets involved with French werewolves who have developed a serum allowing them to transform at will.

title: European Vacation (aka National Lampoon's European Vacation) (1985)
actors: Chevy Chase, Beverly D'Angelo, Dana Hill, Jason Lively
description: The Griswolds win a vacation tour across Europe where the usual havoc ensues.

title: National Lampoon's Vacation (1983)
actors: Chevy Chase, Beverly D'Angelo, Imogene Coca, Randy Quaid
description: The Griswold family's cross-country drive to the Walley World theme park proves to be much more arduous than they ever anticipated.

title: Funny Farm (1988)
actors: Chevy Chase, Madolyn Smith Osborne, Kevin O'Morrison, Joseph Maher
description: A couple swap city life for the country, but their picturesque new hometown turns out to be just a little bit different to what they were expecting.

title: Big (1988)
actors: Tom Hanks, Elizabeth Perkins, Robert Loggia, John Heard
description: After wishing to be made big, a teenage boy wakes the next morning to find himself mysteriously in the body of an adult.

title: Problem Child (1990)
actors: John Ritter, Jack Warden, Michael Oliver, Gilbert Gottfried
description: A young boy just short of a monster is adopted by a loving man and his wacky wife. The laughs keep coming as the boy pushes them to the limits.

title: Problem Child 2 (1991)
actors: John Ritter, Michael Oliver, Jack Warden, Laraine Newman
description: The worst child in the world makes an unthinkable discovery: there is another child even worse than he is--and it's a girl.

title: Little Nemo: Adventures in Slumberland (1992)
actors: Gabriel Damon, Mickey Rooney, Rene Auberjonois, Danny Mann
description: Each night, young Nemo goes to Slumberland and has adventures and befriends the king of Slumberland, Morpheus. But one night Nemo discovers Nightmare Land, and the evil nightmare king, throwing Slumberland and Nemo himself into danger.

title: Oscar and Lucinda (a.k.a. Oscar & Lucinda) (1997)
actors: Ralph Fiennes, Cate Blanchett, Ciarán Hinds, Tom Wilkinson
description: In mid-1800s England, Oscar is a young Anglican priest, a misfit and an outcast, but with the soul of an angel. As a boy, even though from a strict Pentecostal family, he felt God told him through a sign to leave his father and his faith and join the Church of England. Lucinda is a teen-aged Australian heiress who has an almost desperate desire to liberate her sex from the confines of the male-dominated culture of the Australia of that time. She buys a glass factory and has a dream of building a church made almost entirely of glass, and then transporting it to Bellingen, a remote settlement on the north coast. Oscar and Lucinda meet on a ship going to Australia; once there, they are for different reasons ostracized from society, and as a result "join forces" together. Oscar and Lucinda are both passionate gamblers, and Lucinda bets Oscar her entire inheritance that he cannot transport the glass church to the Outback safely. Oscar accepts her wager, and this leads to the events that will change both their lives forever.

title: Tequila Sunrise (1988)
actors: Mel Gibson, Michelle Pfeiffer, Kurt Russell, Raul Julia
description: A former L.A. drug dealer tries to go straight but his past and his underworld connections bring him into the focus of the DEA, the Mexican feds and the Mexican drug cartels.

title: Pelican Brief, The (1993)
actors: Julia Roberts, Denzel Washington, Sam Shepard, John Heard
description: A law student uncovers a conspiracy, putting herself and others in danger.

title: Christmas Story, A (1983)
actors: Melinda Dillon, Darren McGavin, Scott Schwartz, Jean Shepherd
description: In the 1940s, a young boy named Ralphie Parker attempts to convince his parents, teacher, and Santa Claus that a Red Ryder Range 200 Shot BB gun really is the perfect Christmas gift.

title: Mickey Blue Eyes (1999)
actors: Hugh Grant, James Caan, Jeanne Tripplehorn, Burt Young
description: An English auctioneer proposes to the daughter of a Mafia kingpin, only to realize that certain "favors" would be asked of him.

title: Teaching Mrs. Tingle (1999)
actors: Helen Mirren, Katie Holmes, Jeffrey Tambor, Barry Watson
description: The story of a girl who is willing to do anything to become Valedictorian, even if it means murdering the teacher that stands in her way.

title: Universal Soldier: The Return (1999)
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Michael Jai White, Heidi Schanz, Xander Berkeley
description: The "universal soldiers" must fight the whole army, when the military's supercomputer S.E.T.H gets out of control.

title: Universal Soldier (1992)
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dolph Lundgren, Ally Walker, Ed O'Ross
description: Soldiers who were killed during the Vietnam conflict are brought back to life in a top secret military experiment that creates superhuman warriors.

title: Perfect Blue (1997)
actors: Junko Iwao, Rica Matsumoto, Shinpachi Tsuji, Masaaki Ôkura
description: A pop singer gives up her career to become an actress, but she slowly goes insane when she starts being stalked by an obsessed fan and what seems to be a ghost of her past.

title: In Too Deep (1999)
actors: Lloyd Adams, Philip Akin, Anna Carolina Arias, Karina Arroyave
description: Right out of police academy, Jeff/Omar Epps starts as undercover cop in Cincinnati. First it's small time cases but he proves himself and moves up to a big case - befriending a brutal crime boss.

title: Source, The (1999)
actors: Johnny Depp, Dennis Hopper, John Turturro, Allen Ginsberg
description: Traces the Beats from Allen Ginsberg and Jack Kerouac's meeting in 1944 at Columbia University to the deaths of Ginsberg and William S. Burroughs in 1997. Three actors provide dramatic interpretations of the work of these three writers, and the film chronicles their friendships, their arrival into American consciousness, their travels, frequent parodies, Kerouac's death, and Ginsberg's politicization. Their movement connects with bebop, John Cage's music, abstract expressionism, and living theater. In recent interviews, Ginsberg, Burroughs, Kesey, Ferlinghetti, Mailer, Jerry Garcia, Tom Hayden, Gary Snyder, Ed Sanders, and others measure the Beats' meaning and impact.

title: Iron Eagle (1986)
actors: Louis Gossett Jr. , Jason Gedrick, David Suchet, Tim Thomerson
description: A young pilot plans a rescue mission when his father, an Air Force Colonel, is shot down over enemy territory and captured.

title: Iron Eagle II (1988)
actors: Louis Gossett Jr. , Mark Humphrey, Stuart Margolin, Alan Scarfe
description: A joint U.S.- Soviet strike force is assembled to wipe out a nuclear base in an outlaw nation that plans to take the world hostage.

title: Aces: Iron Eagle III (1992)
actors: Louis Gossett Jr. , Rachel McLish, Paul Freeman, Horst Buchholz
description: Chappy discovers a drug-smuggling scheme at his own air base. It turns out that the lives of some village people in Peru are at stake, and he decides to fly there with ancient airplanes and friends to free them.

title: Iron Eagle IV (1995)
actors: Louis Gossett Jr. , Jason Cadieux, Joanne Vannicola, Max Piersig
description: Fighter pilot Doug Masters teaches at his flight school for teens in trouble with the law. In an emergency landing on a deserted airforce base, the kids accidentally uncover a deranged plot to wage chemical warfare.

title: Three Days of the Condor (3 Days of the Condor) (1975)
actors: Robert Redford, Faye Dunaway, Cliff Robertson, Max von Sydow
description: A bookish CIA researcher in Manhattan finds all his co-workers dead, and must outwit those responsible until he figures out who he can really trust.

title: Hamlet (1964)
actors: Richard Burton, Hume Cronyn, Alfred Drake, Eileen Herlie
description: The highly successful 1964 Richard Burton Broadway production of "Hamlet", deliberately staged in the style of a "dress rehearsal", but performed in front of a live audience.

title: Medicine Man (1992)
actors: Sean Connery, Lorraine Bracco, José Wilker, Rodolfo De Alexandre
description: In the beautiful and dangerous Amazon rainforest, dissimilar people must make their choices between business, science, and love.

title: On the Ropes (1999)
actors: Sam Doumit, Martin Goldman, Harry Keitt, Randy Little
description: The story of three young boxers and their coach who is determined to guide them in a positive direction in and out of the ring.

title: 13th Warrior, The (1999)
actors: Antonio Banderas, Diane Venora, Dennis Storhøi, Vladimir Kulich
description: A man, having fallen in love with the wrong woman, is sent by the sultan himself on a diplomatic mission to a distant land as an ambassador. Stopping at a Viking village port to restock on supplies, he finds himself unwittingly embroiled in a quest to banish a mysterious threat in a distant Viking land.

title: Astronaut's Wife, The (1999)
actors: Johnny Depp, Charlize Theron, Joe Morton, Clea DuVall
description: After an explosion in space and subsequent two-minute radio-out period, two astronauts return home to their wives. Slightly it's revealed that they're not the same as they were.

title: Dudley Do-Right (1999)
actors: Brendan Fraser, Sarah Jessica Parker, Alfred Molina, Eric Idle
description: Inept Canadian mountie Dudley Do-Right chases after villian Snidely Whiplash and woos girlfriend Nell Fenwick.

title: Muse, The (1999)
actors: Albert Brooks, Sharon Stone, Andie MacDowell, Jeff Bridges
description: With his career on the skids, a Hollywood screenwriter enlists the aid of a modern-day muse, who proves to test his patience.

title: Chill Factor (1999)
actors: Cuba Gooding Jr. , Skeet Ulrich, Peter Firth, David Paymer
description: A new biological chemical weapon that explodes up to temperatures over fifty degrees Fahrenheit, falls into the hands of two men who try to make sure that it doesn't get stolen by a terrorist.

title: Outside Providence (1999)
actors: Shawn Hatosy, Tommy Bone, Samantha Lavigne, Jonathan Brandis
description: After one too many run ins with the law, a punk teenager from a working class background is sent to prep school by his frustrated dad, and learns a thing or two.

title: Bedrooms & Hallways (1998)
actors: Kevin McKidd, Julie Graham, Simon Callow, Con O'Neill
description: At the suggestion of a straight friend, gay man Leo joins a men's group, where he causes some upsets by declaring his attraction to one of its members.

title: West Beirut (West Beyrouth) (1998)
actors: Rami Doueiri, Naamar Sahli, Mohamad Chamas, Rola Al Amin
description: In April, 1975, civil war breaks out; Beirut is partitioned along a Moslem-Christian line. Tarek is in high school, making Super 8 movies with his friend, Omar. At first the war is a lark: school has closed, the violence is fascinating, getting from West to East is a game. His mother wants to leave; his father refuses. Tarek spends time with May, a Christian, orphaned and living in his building. By accident, Tarek goes to an infamous brothel in the war-torn Olive Quarter, meeting its legendary madam, Oum Walid. He then takes Omar and May there using her underwear as a white flag for safe passage. Family tensions rise. As he comes of age, the war moves inexorably from adventure to tragedy.

title: Stigmata (1999)
actors: Patricia Arquette, Gabriel Byrne, Jonathan Pryce, Nia Long
description: When a young woman becomes afflicted by stigmata, a priest is sent to investigate her case, which may have severe ramifications for his faith and for the Catholic Church itself.

title: Stir of Echoes (1999)
actors: Zachary David Cope, Kevin Bacon, Kathryn Erbe, Illeana Douglas
description: After being hypnotized by his sister-in-law, a man begins seeing haunting visions of a girl's ghost and a mystery begins to unfold around him.

title: Black Cat, White Cat (Crna macka, beli macor) (1998)
actors: Bajram Severdzan, Srdjan 'Zika' Todorovic, Branka Katic, Florijan Ajdini
description: Matko and his son Zare live on the banks of the Danube river and get by through hustling and basically doing anything to make a living. In order to pay off a business debt Matko agrees to marry off Zare to the sister of a local gangster.

title: Minus Man, The (1999)
actors: Owen Wilson, Sheryl Crow, Dwight Yoakam, Dennis Haysbert
description: Aimless Vann Siegert takes a bizarre turn in life and becomes a serial killer, tracking down the miserable, the self-destructive and those who otherwise seem willing to die.

title: Adventures of Milo and Otis, The (Koneko monogatari) (1986)
actors: Dudley Moore, Chatran, Kyôko Koizumi, Pû
description: The adventures of a young cat and a dog as they find themselves accidentally separated and each swept into a hazardous trek.

title: Only Angels Have Wings (1939)
actors: Cary Grant, Jean Arthur, Richard Barthelmess, Rita Hayworth
description: At a remote South American trading port, the manager of an air-freight company is forced to risk his pilots' lives in order to win an important contract as a traveling American showgirl stops in town.

title: Othello (Tragedy of Othello: The Moor of Venice, The) (1952)
actors: Micheál MacLiammóir, Suzanne Cloutier, Orson Welles, Robert Coote
description: The Moorish General Othello is manipulated into thinking that his new wife Desdemona has been carrying on an affair with his Lieutenant Michael Cassio when in reality, it is all part of the scheme of a bitter Ensign named Iago.

title: Soldier's Story, A (1984)
actors: Howard E. Rollins Jr. , Adolph Caesar, Art Evans, David Alan Grier
description: An African-American officer investigates a murder in a racially charged situation in World War II.

title: I Saw What You Did (1965)
actors: Joan Crawford, John Ireland, Leif Erickson, Sara Lane
description: Teenagers Libby and Kit innocently spend an evening making random prank calls that lead to murderous consequences.

title: Yellow Submarine (1968)
actors: The Beatles, Paul Angelis, John Clive, Dick Emery
description: The Beatles agree to accompany Captain Fred in his yellow submarine and go to Pepperland to free it from the music-hating Blue Meanies.

title: American Beauty (1999)
actors: Kevin Spacey, Annette Bening, Thora Birch, Wes Bentley
description: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.

title: Stop Making Sense (1984)
actors: Bernie Worrell, Alex Weir, Steven Scales, Lynn Mabry
description: An innovative concert movie for the rock group Talking Heads.

title: Blue Streak (1999)
actors: Martin Lawrence, Luke Wilson, Peter Greene, Dave Chappelle
description: A former convict poses as a cop to retrieve a diamond he stole years ago.

title: For Love of the Game (1999)
actors: Kevin Costner, Kelly Preston, John C. Reilly, Jena Malone
description: After 19 years of playing the game he's loved his whole life, Detroit Tigers pitcher Billy Chapel has to decide if he's going to risk everything and put everything out there.

title: Caligula (1979)
actors: Malcolm McDowell, Teresa Ann Savoy, Guido Mannari, John Gielgud
description: A dramatization of the ascent to Caesar and subsequent reign of Caligula, one of the most notorious leaders of ancient Rome. We see his ambition, his scheming, his perversion and decadence, his brutality and his lunacy.

title: Hard Day's Night, A (1964)
actors: The Beatles, John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison
description: Over two "typical" days in the life of The Beatles, the boys struggle to keep themselves and Sir Paul McCartney's mischievous grandfather in check while preparing for a live TV performance.

title: Sugar Town (1999)
actors: Jade Gordon, John Taylor, Michael Des Barres, Martin Kemp
description: Unimpassioned look at the lives of struggling L.A. scene rock stars follows main character, Gwen, on her quest for the top. Working as an assistant to a film production designer, she tries to steal her boy friend who is a music producer by offering sexual favors. The producer meanwhile is trying to orchestrate a comeback for a former glam band played by Michael Des Barres (of Power Station fame), John Taylor (from Duran Duran), and Martin Kemp (from Spandau Ballet). Rosanna Arquette plays the former movie star wife of the lead singer, who is fretting because she has just been offered the role as the mother of one of the new ingenious. Beverly D'Angelo also shows up as a millionairess who agrees to bankroll the group, but only if she gets a roll in the hay with the lead singer. All of the career problems, including drug proclivity, are represented in this film.

title: Buddy Holly Story, The (1978)
actors: Gary Busey, Don Stroud, Charles Martin Smith, Conrad Janis
description: The story of the life and career of the early rock and roll singer, from his meteoric rise to stardom, to his marriage and untimely death.

title: Fright Night (1985)
actors: Chris Sarandon, William Ragsdale, Amanda Bearse, Roddy McDowall
description: A teenager believes that the newcomer in his neighborhood is a vampire. He turns to an actor in a television horror show for help to deal with the undead.

title: Fright Night Part II (1988)
actors: Roddy McDowall, William Ragsdale, Traci Lind, Julie Carmen
description: Charley Brewster and Peter Vincent must face more vampires, out for revenge.

title: Barefoot in the Park (1967)
actors: Robert Redford, Jane Fonda, Charles Boyer, Mildred Natwick

title: Deliverance (1972)

description: In the 1950s, an adolescent Werner Herzog was transfixed by a film performance of the young Klaus Kinski. Years later, they would share an apartment where, in an unabated, forty-eight-hour fit of rage, Kinski completely destroyed the bathroom. From this chaos, a violent, love-hate, profoundly creative partnership was born. In 1972, Herzog cast Kinski in Aguirre, der Zorn Gottes (1972). Four more films would follow. In this personal documentary, Herzog traces the often violent ups and downs of their relationship, revisiting the various locations of their films and talking to the people they worked with.

actors: Ian Hart, Sean McGinley, Niamh Cusack, Ruth McCabe
description: Irish lads send an ad to the Miami Herald inviting fit and enticing women, between the ages of 20 and 21, to live in their isolated Donegal village. The whole town knows about the ad, and it sharpens everyone's sense of the opportunities for happiness already at hand. Kate, a publican with a young daughter, is separating from her husband and catches the eye of a bachelor sheep farmer. Kieran the butcher realizes that his assistant Siobhan is comely, and then he discovers she's fiery as well. Ollie sends off for Dutch skin magazines that the village postmistress won't release to him. The men, and women, find counsel in their movie-loving priest. Will anyone answer the ad?

title: East-West (Est-ouest) (1999)
actors: Oleg Menshikov, Sandrine Bonnaire, Catherine Deneuve, Sergey Bodrov
description: In June 1946, Stalin invites the Russian exiled from the 1917 Revolution to return home. When the ships comes ashore in Odessa, the passengers are divided in two groups and one of them is executed. Among the survivors are Dr. Aleksei Golovin, his French wife Marie and their young son. Marie is accused to be a spy, her French passport is torn up and Aleksei accepts to move to Kyiv with his family to save her. They are sent to a room in a communal house and soon Marie befriends the super, an old woman who speaks French. But she is denounced and killed by the government agents. Marie feels guilty and brings her grandson Sasha Vasilyev, who will be evicted, to live in her room with her family. Marie wants to return to her family in France, but Aleksei explains that they are imprisoned in Russia. Marie tries a contact with the leftist French actress Gabrielle Develay to ask for help to leave the USSR. While Marie gets distant from her husband, she gets closer to Sacha, who is a great swimmer and the only chance to Marie contact her family.

actors: Albert Brooks, Michael Durrell, James Eckhouse, Gary Beach

title: Wonderland (1999)
actors: Shirley Henderson, Gina McKee, Molly Parker, Ian Hart
description: There's little wonder in the working-class lives of Bill, Eileen, and their three grown daughters. They're lonely Londoners. Nadia, a café waitress, places personal ads, looking for love; Debbie, a single mother, entertains men at the hair salon after hours; her son spends part of the weekend with her ex, a man with a hair-trigger temper. Molly is expecting her first baby and the child's father acts as if the responsibility is too much for him. Eileen is bitter, complaining about her husband and the dog next door; Bill's a doormat. His West Indian neighbour offers him a drink; her own grown son locks himself in his room most of the time. Will anyone connect during this Guy Fawkes weekend?

title: I'm the One That I Want (2000)
actors: Margaret Cho
description: I'm the One That I Want: Directed by Lionel Coleman. With Margaret Cho. November, 1999, Margaret Cho is home in San Francisco at the Warfield Theater. Cho structures her monologue loosely on her professional life's trajectory: doing stand-up, cast in an ABC-TV sitcom, losing 30 pounds in two weeks for the part, the show's cancellation, a descent into booze, pills, and self-loathing, and a resurrection into her own voice, her own shape, and being the one she wants. Along the way we visit Karl Langerfeld in jail, a lesbian cruise ship, a TV Guide photo shoot, a hospital, bars, and her family's Polk Street bookshop. Takes on being a fag hag, speeding up felatio, casual daily racism, and her mother's phone messages highlight a scabrous, brilliant performance.

description: David Allen Griffin is a cool killer- time and time again, he chooses a female victim, studies her for weeks till he knows her routine to the smallest detail, makes meticulous preparations using his forensic knowledge to gain entry when she's quite alone, subdues her and administers a long, torturous death. Joel Campbell got so frustrated by his failure to capture Griffin in Los Angeles, that he quit the FBI, moved to Chicago, and remains in psychiatric therapy, unable to function normally. Then he realizes, when opening his mail very late, that a new murder victim is Griffin's, and the killer sent him pictures of her. Campbell reports this to the police, but is unwilling to join them in the search, suggesting Griffin is too slick and clever; yet he won't get out of it that easily.

description: Colm is a Catholic, and George is a poetry-loving Protestant. In Belfast, Northern Ireland in the 1980s, they could have been enemies, but instead, they became business partners. After persuading a mad wig salesman known as the Scalper to sell them his leads, the two embark on a series of house calls, always in neighborhoods that are dangerous for one or the other partner. Then they find out they might lose their exclusive wig distributorship to competitors. Through a series of comic twists, the pair are given large orders for wigs by both sides of the Protestant and Catholic conflict. Should they compromise their principles in order to keep their business? Will it destroy their friendship? Could one of their wigs in the hands of the I.R.A. actually put one or both of them in jail, or even get them killed?

description: An aging chief's last stand, lessons for the new, and the education of a young chief-to-be played against harsh Nature in Nepal's Dolpo. When his son dies returning from Tibet's salt lakes, Tinle blames Karma, his son's friend, refuses to give Karma his blessing as the new chief, and organizes a rival caravan to take the salt to lower Nepal to trade for grain. He, a few old men, his son's widow, his grandson, and his second son, a monk, set out on the arduous journey. Fearing storms, Karma has led his caravan out of the village before the auspicious day ordained by the lamas. Tinle's group catches Karma's before the final pass; the two stubborn men lock wills with Tinle's grandson watching.

title: Wendigo (2001)
actors: Patricia Clarkson, Jake Weber, Erik Per Sullivan, John Speredakos
description: George is a high-strung professional photographer who is starting to unravel from the stress of his work with a Manhattan advertising agency. Needing some time away from the city, George, his wife Kim, and their son Miles head to upstate New York to take in the winter sights, though the drive up is hardly relaxing for any of them. George accidentally hits and severely injures a deer that ran onto the icy road; after George stops to inspect the damage, he's confronted by an angry local named Otis who flies into a rage, telling George that he and his fellow hunters had been tracking the deer for some time. An argument breaks out, which leaves George feeling deeply shaken. When George and Kim arrive at their cabin, they discover that it's next door to Otis' property, and they soon find that a dark and intimidating presence seems to have taken over the cottage. Since, when they stopped at a store en route to the cabin, a shopkeeper told Miles about the legend of the Wendigo, a beast from Indian folklore who is half-man, half-deer, and can change itself at will, the child begins to wonder if the creature might have something to do with his family's sudden misfortune.

actors: Moishe Bar Am, B. Z. Goldberg, Shlomo Green, Sanabel Hassan
description: Several Jewish and Palestinian children are followed for three years and put in touch with each other, in this alternative look at the Jewish-Palestinian conflict. The three filmmakers followed a group of seven local children between 1995 and 1998. They all have a totally different background. These seven children tell their own story about growing up in Jerusalem. Through this portrait of their generation, we see how deep rooted and almost insoluble the problems of the Middle East have become. When the protagonists speak out in an epilogue a couple of years later, it becomes apparent that all have lost their childlike innocence.

When Kate begins a fling with a handsome younger man, less worldly than her friends but passionate and sincere, the other women can't simply be happy for the couple's unusual new romance. In jealousy they promptly take it upon themselves to break up the pair, taking drastic measures which result in unintended outcomes, some happy and some tragic.

actors: William Daniels, Howard Da Silva, Ken Howard, Donald Madden

director: Arthur Lubin, Gerry Chiniquy, Robert McKimson, Hawley Pratt, Bill Tytla
actors: Don Knotts, Carole Cook, Jack Weston, Andrew Duggan
description: Meek and mild mannered bookkeeper Henry Limpet has few passions in life. It's mid-1941 and he would love to join the Navy but has been rated 4F. His friend George Stickle is in the Navy and lays it on pretty thick. If Henry could have one thing it would be to become a fish. While on a visit to Coney Island, Henry falls into the water and miraculously gets his wish. Now a fish, he makes friends, Ladyfish and Crusty the hermit crab and loves his new life. He also uses his abilities to help the US Navy locate and sink Nazi U-Boats, forcing the Germans to create a new weapon to deal with the Allies secret weapon. When years later the Navy finds intelligent activity among dolphins, they may also know who is teaching them.

actors: Dennis Hopper, Kiefer Sutherland, Carol Kane, Paul Dooley

actors: Stanislaw Tym, Barbara Burska, Christine Paul, Krzysztof Kowalewski
description: The main character is the manager of a sport club, nicknamed "Teddy Bear" by his friends and acquaintances. One day he is detained at the border just as his sport team is off to a tournament - somebody has torn out a few pages from his passport. It occurs to him that perhaps his ex-wife has done so to get her hands on their joint account in a London bank. Therefore, he has to get to London as soon as possible in order to transfer the money to a different bank. The solution is a movie, made by his friend. The script requires a double role, thus the search for a character is announced. The double has to apply for the passport, and that is solved through a girlfriend who agrees to play dope's new fiancée. At the engagement party he is slipped a drug, and Teddy Bear runs off to the airport with the false passport. On the plane, however, he meets his ex-wife...

In a clinic, where he goes by chance, he meets Martha and falls in love with her. After a series of funny situations (an old friend from the relentless chatter coming from Naples and the mature aunt and her elderly lover, a young American priest who wants to involve him in his visits to evangelical force, the encounter with Riccardino, a young man frustrated by an oppressive mother and the father waiting for the miracle of re-growth of an amputated hand, etc.) Gaetano decides to stay in Florence and to act as father to Martha's incoming son, even if the girl does not want to disclose the exact name of the father.

After he receives a map from a dying pirate, he embarks on an odyssey across the universe to find the legendary Treasure Planet.

actors: Alisa Freyndlikh, Larisa Guzeeva, Nikita Mikhalkov, Andrey Myagkov

title: Elling (2001)
actors: Per Christian Ellefsen, Sven Nordin, Marit Pia Jacobsen, Jørgen Langhelle
description: When his mother, who has sheltered him his entire 40 years, dies, sensitive would-be poet Elling is sent to live in a state institution. There he meets Kjell Bjarne, a gentle giant and woman-obsessed virgin in his 40s. After two years, the men are released and provided with a state-funded apartment and stipend with the hope they will be able to live on their own. Initially, the simple act of going around the corner for groceries is a challenge. Through a friendship born of desperate dependence, the skittish Elling and the boisterous, would-be ladies' man Kjell Bjarne discover that not only can they survive on the outside--they can thrive. But as their courage grows, they find oddball ways to cope with society and strike up friendships in the unlikeliest places.

He plays along with his family, advocates of the suffocating traditions of their Georgian Jewish heritage. But Zaza always manages to somehow get out of being engaged. What his parents don't know is that Zaza is already in love. Judith is sensuous, strong and intriguing. She's also a divorcée with a 6-year-old daughter. title: Cinemania (2002)
actors: Jack Angstreich, Eric Chadbourne, Bill Heidbreder, Roberta Hill
description: This documentary about the culture of intense cinephilia in New York City reveals the impassioned world of five obsessed movie buffs. The filmmakers expose this delightfully deranged cult by capturing the daily lives of its members. Interviews in movie houses, on the street and in the homes of the subjects tell the story of each individual. Many cannot hold a job, or choose not to. All of them have demoted the importance of the real world, giving all of their attention to the fantasy world of the movies. These human encyclopedias of cinema see two to five films a day, and from 600 to 2,000 films per year. Many have no physical sex lives, living instead in a world of romance with stars like James Dean or Audrey Hepburn. In Cinemania, Hollywood's biggest fans become the true stars. This is the story of their lives, their memories, their unbending habits and the films they love.

title: Revolution OS (2001)
actors: Linus Torvalds, Richard Stallman, Eric Raymond, Bruce Perens
description: While Microsoft may be the biggest software company in the world, not every computer user is a fan of their products, or their way of doing business. While Microsoft's Windows became the most widely used operating system for personal computers in the world, many experts took issue with Microsoft's strict policies regarding licensing, ownership, distribution, and alteration of their software. The objections of many high-profile technology experts, most notably Richard Stallman, led to what has become known as "the Open Source Movement," which is centered on the belief that computer software should be free both in the economic and intellectual senses of the word. Eventually, one of Stallman's admirers, Linus Torvalds, created a new operating system called Linux, a freely distributed software which many programmers consider to be markedly superior to Windows. Revolution OS is a documentary that examines the genesis of the Open Source Movement, and explores and explains the technical and intellectual issues involved in a manner understandable to computer aficionados and non-techheads alike.

title: Death in Venice (Morte a Venezia) (1971)

actors: David Emge, Ken Foree, Scott H. Reiniger, Gaylen Ross
description: During an escalating zombie epidemic, two Philadelphia SWAT team members, a traffic reporter and his TV executive girlfriend seek refuge in a secluded shopping mall.

title: Prey for Rock & Roll (2003)
actors: Gina Gershon, Drea de Matteo, Lori Petty, Shelly Cole
description: Prey For Rock & Roll is the story of Jacki and her all-girl rock and roll band, Clam Dandy, who are trying to make it in the LA club scene of the late 1980s. After ten years of being ignored by record producers, Jacki and the band find hope in one producer who promises to see them play and consider them for a contract. Jacki resolves to play this one last gig and then throw in the towel if she does not find success. Personal tragedies, however, threaten to rip the band apart, rocking the foundation of friendship and trust the women have built together. Ultimately, the band must find its strength in the music that is their passion and the thread that holds them together, inspiring them to prevail.

actors: Stuart Whitman, Sarah Miles, James Fox, Alberto Sordi

title: Cheaper by the Dozen (1950)
actors: Clifton Webb, Jeanne Crain, Myrna Loy, Betty Lynn
description: Myrna Loy plays the wife of the persnickety father of her 12 children, Clifton Webb, who has uniquely humorous methods for dealing with the ordeals such an unwieldy family undoubtedly encounters.

title: Scenes From a Marriage (Scener ur ett äktenskap) (1973)
Munchies (1987)
actors: Harvey Korman, Charlie Stratton, Nadine Van der Velde, Alix Elias
description: Simon Watterman, a space archaeologist, discovers the "Munchies" in a cave in Peru. Cecil Watterman, Simon's evil twin brother and snack food entrepreneur, kidnaps the creature. What Cecil does not know is that the creature, when chopped up, regenerates into many new creatures -- and are they mean!

actors: George Burns, Art Carney, Lee Strasberg, Charles Hallahan

title: Mudge Boy, The (2003)
actors: Emile Hirsch, Tom Guiry, Richard Jenkins, Pablo Schreiber
description: The film follows the story of Duncan, a fourteen-year-old misfit farm boy trying to fill the void and alleviate the numbness left by his mother's passing. Unable to let her go quite yet, Duncan mimics his dead mother. He talks in her voice at the dinner table and wears her fur coat to bed. Edgar, Duncan's distant sixty-year-old father, doesn't understand the strange manifestations of his son's mourning. Why can't Duncan grieve like a normal person? Macho mate Perry Foley, who has it physically even harder on his dad's farm, usually comforts Duncan and defends his 'wimpiness' to their cocky ruffian mates Travis, Scotty and Brent. But although clearly attracted to gentle Duncan himself, the socially unacceptable suggestion of 'sissy' homosexuality makes Perry over-react and turn on his friend.

title: Breakin' All the Rules (2004)
actors: Jamie Foxx, Gabrielle Union, Morris Chestnut, Peter MacNicol

Doc learns from experience and the tragic stories of hideous crimes which landed scum there and passionate dramas adding otherwise decent people. Just when he believes to leave the prisoners happy with a soccer tournament, a silly clothing-line argument kick-starts a politically opportune revolt repression.

description: This Hong Kong martial-arts extravaganza tells of evil emperors and true love. The secret Red Lotus Flower Society is committed to the overthrow of the evil Manchu Emperor and his minions. One of his Governors is sent on a mission to retrieve a list of members of that secret society. Meanwhile, Canton kung fu practitioner Fong Sai-Yuk falls in love with the beautiful daughter of a rich merchant, recently moved to Canton. Her father, in an attempt to gain influence in the region and thus improve his business, offers his daughter in marriage to the winner of a kung-fu contest. Some interesting gender role-reversals take place during a 'comedy of errors.'

description: Notorious C.H.O.: Directed by Lorene Machado. With Margaret Cho. A film of Margaret Cho's one-woman stand-up show, in which she presents her take on modern sexual topics and minority issues.
